The pill stops your body from ovulating, but as soon as you stop taking the pill, Your ovulation will start again . So, it's possible to get pregnant as soon as you stop the pill.

In most cases, it's possible to become pregnant after 3 months, but it usually takes several additional months for the complete effect of the hormone to wear off and to begin ovulating and having regular periods again.

Improve Sexual Health/Intimacy
Gels and Lubricants

Lubricants, also called gels or lubes, are special fluids used during sex. They help reduce friction, discomfort, and dryness, making sex more pleasurable and preventing condoms from breaking. Lubricants come in water-based, silicone-based, or oil-based types. Water-based lubes are safe with all condoms, they don't change the vagina's pH, don't stain clothes, and wash off easily with water. Silicone and oil-based lubes should only be used with specific condom materials.

Click to listen to a short introduction of Lubricant in Pidgin, if you want.
Hard Erection

Penegra is a product that used to treat erectile dysfunction. Erectile Dysfunction refers to the consistent/inability of a man to obtain an erection sufficient for satisfactory sex.

Penegra helps to induce a hard erection which can last for an extended duration thereby enhancing confidence, well-being, and satisfaction. Penegra only induces a hard erection when the penis is stimulated.
You can click on the audio below to listen to a short introduction of Penegra in Pidgin, if you want to.
You can click to watch a video on how to use this lubricant in Pidgin.

Sex can be enjoyed more with lubricants and gels.
Hard erection can also be induced for more pleasured sex.

What do you want to learn more about?
I had unprotected sex recently. What do I do to avoid pregnancy?
I want to prevent pregnancy in the future.

To avoid pregnancy after unprotected sex, you can take emergency contraceptive pills.

Emergency contraceptive pills are taken immediately after unprotected sex to prevent pregnancy.

Emergency pills are very effective when taken within 24 to 72 hours after unprotected sex. You are advised to not take it more than 3 times in a month. If you are ovulating, you should use an alternative contraceptive plan (condoms).

Please note that they are not effective if you are already pregnant.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available emergency contraceptive pills.

Postpill can be taken within 5 days after sex, while Postinor2 is effective within 3 days.

Which product do you want to learn about?

Allright. I am happy to provide you with more information about family planning methods that are effective and safe for you.

For how long do you want to prevent pregnancy?

Short Term
(up to 1 year)

Long Term
(1 year to permanent)

The short-term family planning methods are:

1. Daily contraceptive pills
2. The barrier contraceptives which are the diaphragms and Condoms
3. Injectables.

Click on any of them to get the full details about them.
For how long do you want to prevent pregnancy?

Postpill is a one-dose emergency contraceptive pill by DKT. It contains 1.5 mg Levongestrel. POSTPILL should be taken orally as soon as possible within 24 hours but can still be taken within 5 days (120 hours) of unprotected sex.

You can buy Postpill at any pharmacy or health store around you.

Postinor is an Emergency Contraceptive Pill (ECP) that safely prevents unwanted pregnancy within 72 hours after unprotected sexual intercourse.

It doesn’t work if you are already pregnant and will not harm an already established pregnancy. The sooner you take POSTINOR, the more effective it is.

You can buy Postinor at any pharmacy or health store around you.
Daily contraceptive pills
Female condom
Male Condom

Daily pills are combined oral contraceptive (COC) pills for pregnancy prevention, dermatological and gynecological conditions, and management of menstrual irregularities (heavy bleeding, painful menstruation, premenstrual syndrome).
They work by thickening the mucus around the cervix, which makes it difficult for sperm to enter the uterus and reach any eggs that may have been released.
Daily pills are either a 21-day pack (Dianofem and Desofem) or a 28-day pack (Levofem). One pill is taken each day at about the same time for 21 days. Depending on your pack, you will either have a 7-day break (as in the 21-day pack) or you will take the pill that contains Iron for 7 days (the 28-day pack).
Click to listen to a short introduction of daily pills in Pidgin, if you want to.
Audio embedding (Daily pills)

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of daily pills includes.

Advantages

1. They are very effective if used correctly.
2. Very safe for the majority of women.
3. Return to fertility is very fast.
4. They regularize the menstrual cycle, reduce heavy menstrual flow, and reduce menstrual and ovulation pain.
5. They are simple and easy to use.

and Disadvantages
1. They must be taken daily which might be difficult to comply with.
2. They might cause mild and temporary side effect which usually goes away after some weeks such as:
a. Mild headache.
b. Nausea or vomiting.
c. Spotting or bleeding at intervals.
d. Breast tenderness and soreness to touch.
e. Mood changes.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use daily pills.

Who can use
1.You can use daily pills if you want a short-term contraceptive method.
2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from six months after birth)
3. If you have irregular menstrual cycle.
4. If you don't have migrainous headaches.
5. If you are taking antibiotics, antifungal or antiparasitic medications.
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?

Who cannot use 1. If you are a breastfeeding mother from 6 weeks to 6 months postpartum. 2. If you are a smoker and over 35 years old. 3. If you have any of the following medical conditions, it is not advisable to take daily piils: a. Blood Pressure b. Venous thromboembolism c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease f. Breast Cancer g. Diabetes h. Sickle-cell Anaemia
I don't know
Ok, it is not advisable for you to take daily pills. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraceptive.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available daily contraceptive pills.
Click on any of them to get their full details.

Levofem is a safe, low-dose, combined oral contraceptive used to prevent pregnancy. Each pack contains 21 active yellow tablets and 7 placebo(inactive) tablets which should be taken around the same time daily.
You can buy Levofem at any pharmacy or health store around you.

How to Use 1. Take your first pill from the packet marked with the correct day of the week, or the first pill of the first colour (phasic pills) 2. Continue to take a pill at the same time each day until the pack is finished. Continue taking pills for seven days (during these seven days you will get a bleed). 3. Start your next pack of pills on the eighth day, whether you are still bleeding or not. This should be the same day of the week as when you took your first pill

Dianofem is a safe and effective pill that contains a combination of an antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) and estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) used for the treatment of dermatological and gynecological conditions in women. It also prevents pregnancy. It contains 21 tablets with no placebo (inactive pills).
How to Use<br style="border-color: var(--border-color);">Take one tablet daily for 21 days, followed by a 7-day break where no tablets are taken. Start the next pack after the 7-day break.

How to Use
One pill is taken around the same time daily for 21 days followed by a 7-day break, then continue with the next pack.

Injectable contraceptives are a form of hormonal birth control for women. They consist of 2-3 monthly injections containing an estrogen and a progestin to prevent pregnancy.

The injection works by preventing the ovaries from releasing an egg each month. It also thickens the fluid around the cervix.

They can be used for pregnancy prevention for 1 to 3 months.

Ok, let me tell you some of the advantages and disadvantages of injectable contraceptives.

Advantages
1. They are highly effective and safe.
2. They do not interfer with sexual intercourse.
3. They can be self administered or provided by a trained non-medical personnel.
4. They protect against ectopic pregnancy.
5.They reduce symptoms of endometriosis.
6. They are convenient, easy to use and administered once in a month.

Now to the disadvantages of injectable contraceptives.

Disadvantages
1. They require regular visit to the to the clinic (monthly)
2. Return to fertility is delayed.
3.Their commom sides effects include:
a. Weight changes.
b. Headache.
c. Dizziness.
d. Breast tenderness.
e. Mood changes.
f. Menstrual change.
g. Decreased libido.
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?

On who can use and who cannot use injectables.
Who can use 1. Women who cannot use combined oral contraceptives. 2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from six months after birth) 3. If you just had an abortion or miscarriage and still want to prevent pregnancy. 4. If you dont't have migrainous headaches. 5. If you have endometrial or ovarian cancer, you can still use this method.

Who cannot use 1. If you are a breastfeeding mother from 6 weeks to 6 months postpartum. 2. If you are a smoker and over 35 years old. 3. If you have any of the following medical conditions, it is not advisable to take daily piils: a. Blood Pressure. b. Venous thromboembolism. c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease. f. Breast Cancer. g. Diabetes. h. Vascular Disease. i. Vaginal bleeding
I don't know

Ok, sorry about your medical condition but it is not advisable for you to adopt this method of contraception.

Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraceptive.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available Injectable contraceptives.

Click on any of them to get their full details.
Sayana Press

Progesta is an injectable contraceptive, a highly safe and effective contraceptive, injected intramuscularly and sometimes into the anus for 3 months continuously. 

Its mechanism of action are
• thicken cervical mucus.
• inhibits ovulation.
• thins uterus walls to prevent ovulation.
You can visit a family planning clinic/provider if you want to adopt this method.
Audio embedding (Progesta)

Advantages of progesta include 
• Safe, highly effective, discontinued at will.
• Long-acting, 
• Provided outside the clinic, 
• Reversible, easy to use, private, and non-contraceptive benefit. 

Users include heavy smokers, thyroid disorders, diabetes, those 18 years old or younger, breastfeeding mothers, and pelvic inflammatory diseases.

How to use 
• Injected in the upper arm or buttocks, start at any time during the menstrual cycle. 
• 5 days after menstrual period, abstain from sex for the next 7 days. 
• It can be administered after abortion. 
• Start 6 weeks after delivery for a breastfeeding woman.
ADOPTION (CLINIC)
You can click on the audio below to listen to a short introduction of Sayana press in Pidgin, if you want to.
Sayana Press is indicated for long-term female contraception. Each subcutaneous injection prevents ovulation and provides contraception for at least 13 weeks
You can also click to watch a video on how to inject a Sayana Press in Pidgin.
Audio embedding (Sayana Press)

A diaphragm or cap is a type of barrier contraceptive device inserted into the vagina before sex to cover the cervix so that sperm can't get into the womb (uterus). You need to use spermicide with it (spermicides kill sperm). The diaphragm must be left in place for at least 6 hours after sex. The diaphragm is a vaginal barrier contraceptive that is woman-controlled, nonhormonal, and appropriate for women who cannot or do not want to use hormonal contraceptive methods, intrauterine devices, or condoms.
Click to listen to a short introduction of diaphragm in Pidgin, if you want.
Audio embedding (Diaphragm)

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of Diaphragms.

Advantages
1. Diaphragms do not have hormones, so no side effects.
2. Good option for women who prefer non-hormonal contraceptive methods.
3. They may be fitted at any time (post-partum mothers must wait for 6 weeks after delivery or mid-trimester abortion) 
4. They can be inserted up to 6 hours before sex to avoid interruption. 
5. Only used when needed and gives the woman absolute control.
6. One size fits most women.
7. Portable and convenient - it comes with a specially designed case that is discreet and fits in a bag.
8. Easy to use - insertion and removal gets better with practice.
9. Can be used for up to 2 years with proper care.

and 

Disadvantages
1. They are not readily available in Nigeria.
2. They may be expensive to some users.
3. The user must remember to insert the diaphragm before intercourse and keep it in place for at least 6 hours after sex (but not more than 24 hours) 
4. They require special care and storage.
5. They can cause urinary tract infections.
6. A different size of diaphragm may be required after childbirth or if a woman gains weight.
7. They can be damaged by excessive use or poor storage

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use diaphragms.

Who can use
1. If you want a safe and effective non-hormonal form of contraceptive.
2. If you cannot use hormonal methods of contraception for medical reasons.
3. If you are breastfeeding.
4. If you have sexual intercourse occasionally.

Who cannot use
1. If you have an allergy or are sensitive to latex rubber or spermicide.
2. If you have severe uterine prolapse (when the uterus descends toward or into the vagina)
3. If have recurrent urinary tract infections.
4. If you lack facilities (soap and water) to taking care of the diaphragm.
Ok, let me show you what a diaphragm looks like and how to use it.
You can click to watch a video on how to insert and remove a diaphragm and how to use a diaphragm gel in pidgin.

You can visit your nearest pharmacy or health shop to purchase

Female condoms are a barrier method of contraception worn inside the vagina. They are made of thin soft plastic and have two ﬂexible rings – a removable ring at the closed end to help insertion and a fixed ring at the open end, which sits on the vulva to hold the condom in place They prevent pregnancy by stopping sperm from meeting an egg.
and one of its disadvantages is that it might make unpleasant noise during intercourse.

On who can use and who cannot use female condoms.

Who can use
1. If you want a safe and effective non-hormonal form of contraceptive.
2. If you cannot use hormonal methods of contraception for medical reasons.
3. If you have sexual intercourse occasionally.
4. If you have multiple sexual partners
Ok, let me show you what a female condom looks like and how to use it.
You can click to watch a video on how to insert and remove a female condom in Pidgin.
Then if you have genital /uterine prolapse (when the uterus descends toward or into the vagina), you cannot use the female condom.
Video embedding (How to insert a female condom, how to remove a female condom)
You can visit your nearest chemist/pharmacy to buy.
A condom is a thin covering that fits over a hard penis. It decreases the risk of pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections (STIs) by stopping sperm and body fluids from passing between partners.
You can click the audio to listen to how to insert and remove a condom correctly in Pidgin if you want to.
Audio embedding (Use a male condom, Remove a male condom)

Let me tell you some of the effective and available condoms.
Click on any of them to get their full details.
Kiss condoms are gently lubricated to provide you with a silky, natural feeling for increased pleasure and sensitivity.
Gold Circle

Fiesta is a premium condom brand that comes in 14 exciting variants of styles, colours, textures, flavors, shapes and sizes that increase the sensation for both partners.

1. They provide great protection from both pregnancy and STIs/HIV
2. Exciting variants offer enhanced sexual pleasure for both partners.
3. Ensure STIs/HIV protection for women on other family planning methods.
4. Can be used for oral, anal and vaginal sex.
5. 100% electronically tested and manufactured to meet the highest international quality standards.
You can visit your nearest health shop to buy.

Trojan brand latex condoms are made from premium quality latex to help reduce the risk of unintended pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections. Every condom is electronically tested to help ensure reliability. There are more than 30 varieties of Trojan brand condoms.
Durex is a brand of condoms and personal lubricants owned by the British-Dutch company Reckitt Benckiser.

Gold Circle (GC) Condom is SFH Nigeria's pinnacle product. They offer dual protection to encourage family planning and prevent sexually Transmitted Infections. Gold Circle Condoms are made of latex, well lubricated and shrinked-wrapped for maximum pleasure.
3-4 years
1-2 years
5-10 years
If you want to prevent pregnancy within 1-2 years, you can use any of the short-acting family planning methods, the Injectables or the Implants.

You can either use the daily pills, the emergency pills, the injectables or the implants.

Choose any them from the options to get the full details about them.
Emergency contraceptive pills
Contraceptive implants
Daily contraceptive pills
Injectable contraceptives
Redirect to explainer

Contraceptive implants are small, flexible rods inserted under the skin, typically in the arm. They release hormones (usually progestin) to prevent pregnancy.

They are long-term birth control methods also called long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC. They provide contraception, lasting up to 3 - 5 years but can be removed at any time.

They work by preventing the release of egg and thickening the cervical mucus making it difficult for sperm to reach the egg.
Audio embedding (Implants)
Click to listen to a short explanation of implants in Pidgin, if you want to.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of contraceptive implants.

Advantages
1. They can be used at any time in the menstrual cycle, are very effective, and are removed whenever you want to get pregnant.
2. It gives total privacy, no one will know you have it and does not interfere with sex.
3. No frequent clinical follow-up is needed after initial insertion.
4. It is estrogen-free so many people can use it
5. They are long-acting and may help prevent ectopic pregnancy.
6. Does not disturb breast milk production.
7. There is no delay in return to fertility when they are removed.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use implants.

Who can use
1. You can use an implant if you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 1 to 3 years.
2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from 6 weeks after birth)
3. If you cannot tolerate estrogen.
4. If you don't have migrainous headaches.
5. If you have endometrial or ovarian cancer, you can still use this method.

Disadvantages
1. Insertion and removal involve minor surgery and must be performed by a trained professional.
2. You cannot discontinue the method by yourself.
3. They might have some side effects such as:
a. Headache.
b. Nausea or vomiting.
c. Dizziness.
d. Breast tenderness.
e. Weight gain.
f. Menstrual changes.
g. Spotting and irregular vaginal bleeding.

Who cannot use You cannot use implants if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Uncontrolled hypertension. b. Venous thromboembolism. c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease. f. Breast Cancer. g. Kidney infection. h. Vaginal bleeding.
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?
I don't know
Ok, sorry about your medical condition but it is not advisable for you to use contraceptive implants. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraception.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available contraceptive implants.

Click on any of them to get their full details.

Implanon NXT

LEVOPLANT which is a subdermal contraceptive implant, Levoplant has two small flexible rods about matchstick size. It is WHO-prequalified and highly effective for 3 years, it is suitable for most women except pregnant women.

Advantages
• Immediate return to fertility.
• Fewer side effects.
• Thinner trocar for the insertion process. 
• High quality and most affordable 3-year implant in Nigeria.

Common side effects:
• Menstrual changes.
• Headaches.
• Dizziness. 
• Weight changes (loss/Gain)- which is a buildup of water not fat.
• Breast tenderness
ADOPTION (CLINIC)

Jadelle is a contraceptive implant that consists of two small flexible rods (as short as a match stick but thinner) that is inserted under the skin of a woman’s upper arm. It contains 75mg of the hormone Levonorgestrel in each rod. Jadelle implants are over 99% effective and can prevent pregnancy for a period of 5 years.

This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases very low dose of hormone which leaves the body quickly when removed, so the woman can get pregnant without delay.
You can visit a family planning clinic/provider if you want to adopt this method.

Implanon NXT is a contraceptive implant that consists of one small flexible rod that is inserted under the skin of a woman’s upper arm. It contains 65mg of the hormone Etonorgestrel in each rod. Implanon NXT is over 99% effective and can prevent pregnancy for 3 years. Also, it can be stopped anytime the woman wants by asking a health provider to remove it. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases a very low dose of hormone, which leaves the body quickly when removed, so you woman can get pregnant without delay.

Some of its common side effects are
• Headaches.
• Dizziness.
• Breast tenderness.
• Nausea
• Stomach cramping/bloating.
• Weight gain.
• Vaginal irritation/discharge may occur.
If you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 3 - 4 years, it is advisable to adopt long-acting reversible contraception or LARC methods.

Long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC are: 1. The Injectables. 2. The Implants. 3. The IUS. 4. The IUD
While the short-acting methods are: 1. The daily contraceptive Pills. 2. The emergency contraceptive pills. 3. The barrier contraceptives
Choose any them from the options to get the full details about them.
You can still adopt the short-acting family planning methods or the barrier contraceptives if you don't want any device insertion into your body.
Contraceptive implants
Daily contraceptive pills
Injectable contraceptives
Redirect to explainer

Intrauterine system (IUS) are hormonal intrauterine device (IUD). They contain Levenorgestrel for the treatment of some gynecological conditions (endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial hyperplasia, etc.) and pregnancy prevention. It has contraceptive coverage for up to 5 years.

How they work 

For pregnancy prevention, it works by thickening the mucus in the cervix to stop sperm from fertilizing an egg. It also thins out the lining of the uterus and suppresses ovulation and for gynaecological conditions, it reduces the endometrial lining of the womb making the period lighter and less painful.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUS.

Advantages
For pregnancy prevention:
1. No daily use is required.
2. Insertion and removal can be done at any time within the menstrual cycle.
3. Do not require regular clinic visits.
4. It has a quick return to fertility after removal.
5. Safe for breastfeeding mothers from six weeks after delivery.
6. Local release of the home ensures milder side effects.
7. It maintains normal libido.
8. Reduces the risk of ovarian cancer and endometrial cancer.
9. Lower overall risk of ectopic pregnancy than women not on contraception.

For gynecological use:
1. Starts working within 24 hours after insertion.
2. Highly effective for the treatment of abnormally heavy menstrual bleeding.
3. Lowers the risk of anemia due to menstrual blood loss.
4. Effective alternative to surgery especially for women who cannot afford to pay for surgery.
Click to listen to a short explanation of IUS in Pidgin, if you want to.
Audio embedding (Hormonal IUS)
This means that you can use IUS for both gynecological matters and to prevent pregnancy.

Now to the disadvantages of IUS.
Disadvantages 1. Your periods may become irregular or stop completely, which may not be suitable for some people. 2. Self-limiting follicular cysts may develop in the first few cycles. 3. If you get an infection when you have an IUS fitted, it could lead to a pelvic infection if it's not treated. 4. In rare cases, an IUS can make a hole in the womb when it's put in. 5. They might have some side effects such as: a. Headache. b. Nausea or vomiting. c. Breast tenderness. d. Lower abdominal cramps. e. Irregular uterine/vaginal bleeding.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use IUS.

Who can use
1. You can use IUS if you cannot use combined contraceptives.
2. If can use IUS even if you are HIV positive.

Who cannot use You cannot use IUS if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Uncontrolled hypertension. b. Stroke. c. Heart Disease. d. Liver Disease. e. Breast Cancer. f. Cervical cancer. g. Kidney infection. h. Unexplained vaginal bleeding
Ok, sorry about your medical condition but it is not advisable for you to use IUS. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraception.
Ok, let me show you one of the effective IUS products that you can adopt.
Eloira, which is an IUS different from an IUD due to the absence of copper. A hormone (Levonorgestrel) replaces the copper. It is used to treat gynecological conditions and pregnancy prevention.
ADOPTION (CLINIC)

An IUD (Intrauterine Device) is a small T or Y-shaped contraceptive device inserted into the uterus to prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years. They are usually called Copper T or Copper Y.

They are long-lasting, easily reversible, safe, and more than 99% effective in preventing unintended pregnancy.

They work by providing an environment that is toxic and hostile for the sperm thereby preventing them from fertilizing an egg.
Click to listen to a short explanation of IUD in Pidgin, if you want to.
Audio embedding (IUD)

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUD.

Advantages
1. IUDs are highly effective and safe for a majority of women.
2. They are 100% hormone-free, so no hormonal side effects.
3. Can be removed at any time with immediate return to fertility.
4. Can be used as an emergency contraceptive if inserted within 5 days of having unprotected sex.
5. They are private and independent of intercourse.
6. They are long-lasting and can prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years with no drug interaction.

Now to the disadvantages of IUD.

Disadvantages
Complications are rare but may occur and they include;
1. Expulsion of IUD, which may lead to pregnancy.
2. Uterine perforation.
3. They might cause some side effects such as:
a. Irregular and heavy period or bleeding.
b. Menstrual cramps.
c. Abnormal vaginal discharge.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use IUD.

Who can use
1. You can use an IUD if you are very sexually active.
2. You can use an IUD even if you are a breastfeeding mother, a smoker, or have diabetes and hypertension.
3. You can use an IUD if you have currently or history of certain health conditions like stroke, heart disease, liver disease, breast cancer, headaches, lupus, vein thrombosis, etc, and cannot use hormonal contraceptives.
4. You can use an IUD even if you are taking drugs like anti-tuberculosis drugs, anti-convulsant drugs, or anti-retroviral agents, etc.

Who cannot use You cannot use an IUD if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Cervical cancer. b. Endometrial disease. c. Unexplained vaginal bleeding. d. Uterine fibroid with cavity distortion. e. Pelvic tuberculosis. f. Untreated vaginal infection. g. STIs like gonorrhoea and chlamydia.
So do you currently have or previously had any of the medical conditions listed?
I don't know

Lydia IUD devices are non-hormonal, long-lasting contraception (5-10 yrs.) DKT has 5 variants which can be T (the most common) or Y-shaped - made of plastic coat with copper. This device is inserted into the uterus and it is the most effective contraceptive according to WHO with about 99.9% efficacy. It can also serve as an emergency contraceptive if used within 5days of unprotected sexual intercourse.
Its mechanism of action is to inhibit sperm penetration due to the toxicity of copper to sperm

Redirect to explainer

Permanent family planning methods means the person will no longer be able to reproduce again. 

Male: Vasectomy
Female: Tubal ligation

Click on any of them to get a short explanation on them.
Tubal Litigation

Vasectomy is a form of male birth control that cuts the supply of sperm to your semen. It's done by cutting and sealing the tubes that carry sperm.
Vasectomy has a low risk of problems and can usually be performed in an outpatient setting under local anesthesia.
You will need to consult a health care provider.

Tubal Litigation is surgery women can get to "tie" their fallopian tubes. It's a type of female sterilization. The goal is to prevent eggs from travelling from the ovaries to the uterus so you can't get pregnant.

Some of its common side effects are:
a. Abdominal pain or cramping.
b. Fatigue.
c. Dizziness.
d. Gassiness or bloating.
e. Shoulder pain.

You will need to consult a health care provider.

I see! You are at the right place, I can assist you with this topic. 

What best describes your situation?
If more than 120 hours (5 days) have passed since unprotected sex, it won't be effective. In such a situation, kindly consult a healthcare provider as soon as possible to explore other options.

If more than 72 hours (3 days) have passed since unprotected sex, it won't be effective. In such a situation, kindly consult a healthcare provider as soon as possible to explore other options.  It's essential not to delay seeking medical advice in such cases to address any potential risks.

The effects of contraceptive methods on sex life can vary depending on individual experiences and preferences.

Some methods, like hormonal contraceptives (such as birth control pills, patches, or IUDs), may have side effects like changes in libido, mood swings, or dryness.

However, these effects are not universal, and many individuals use contraceptives without experiencing negative impacts on their sex lives.


Other non-hormonal methods like condoms or copper IUDs typically don't affect libido.
Ultimately, it's essential to discuss any concerns or potential side effects with a healthcare provider to find the best option that suits your needs and lifestyle.

I had unprotected sex recently. What do I do to avoid pregnancy?

To avoid pregnancy after unprotected sex, you can take emergency contraceptive pills.

Emergency contraceptive pills are taken immediately after unprotected sex to prevent pregnancy.

Emergency pills are very effective when taken within 24 to 72 hours after unprotected sex. You are advised to not take it more than 3 times in a month. If you are ovulating, you should use an alternative contraceptive plan (condoms).

Please note that they are not effective if you are already pregnant.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available emergency contraceptive pills.

Postpill can be taken within 5 days after sex, while Postinor2 is effective within 3 days.

Which product do you want to learn about?

Allright. I am happy to provide you with more information about family planning methods that are effective and safe for you.

For how long do you want to prevent pregnancy?

2. Magungunan rigakafin gaggawa

Danna kowane ɗayansu don samun cikakkun bayanai game da su.
For how long do you want to prevent pregnancy?

Postpill is a one-dose emergency contraceptive pill by DKT. It contains 1.5 mg Levongestrel. POSTPILL should be taken orally as soon as possible within 24 hours but can still be taken within 5 days (120 hours) of unprotected sex.

You can buy Postpill at any pharmacy or health store around you.

Postpill shine maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa na kashi ɗaya na DKT. Ya ƙunshe 1.5 MG Levongestrel. POSTPILL yakamata a sha shi da wuri cikin sa'o'i 24 zuwa kwanaki 5 (awa 120) bayan jima’i  ba tare da tsaro ba.

Kuna iya siyan maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa wato postpill a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.

Postinor is an Emergency Contraceptive Pill (ECP) that safely prevents unwanted pregnancy within 72 hours after unprotected sexual intercourse.

It doesn’t work if you are already pregnant and will not harm an already established pregnancy. The sooner you take POSTINOR, the more effective it is.

You can buy Postinor at any pharmacy or health store around you.


POSTINOR Kwaya ce ta gaggawa ta hana daukar ciki (ECP) wacce ke hana daukar ciki a cikin sa'o'i 72 bayan jima'i ba tare da kariya ba. 
Ba ya aiki idan an riga an samu shigar ciki kuma ba zai cutar da ciki da aka rigaya aka samu ba. Shan POSTINOR da wuri bayan jima’in, yafi inganci.

Kuna iya siyan shi a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.
Daily contraceptive pills
Male Condom

Daily pills are combined oral contraceptive (COC) pills for pregnancy prevention, dermatological and gynecological conditions, and management of menstrual irregularities (heavy bleeding, painful menstruation, premenstrual syndrome).
They work by thickening the mucus around the cervix, which makes it difficult for sperm to enter the uterus and reach any eggs that may have been released.
Daily pills are either a 21-day pack (Dianofem and Desofem) or a 28-day pack (Levofem). One pill is taken each day at about the same time for 21 days. Depending on your pack, you will either have a 7-day break (as in the 21-day pack) or you will take the pill that contains Iron for 7 days (the 28-day pack).

Click to listen to a short introduction of daily pills in Pidgin, if you want to. 

Danna don sauraron gajeren gabatarwa na kwayoyi na yau da kullun a cikin Pidgin, idan kuna so.
Audio embedding (Daily pills)

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of daily pills includes.

Advantages

1. They are very effective if used correctly.
2. Very safe for the majority of women.
3. Return to fertility is very fast.
4. They regularize the menstrual cycle, reduce heavy menstrual flow, and reduce menstrual and ovulation pain.
5. They are simple and easy to use.

Yanzu ga matsalolin kwayoyin yau da kullun
Matsalolin su
1. Dole ne a sha su kullum wanda zai yi wahala a bi shi. 
2. Suna iya haifar da lahani na dan lokaci wanda yawanci ke wucewa bayan wasu makonni kamar;
a. Ciwon kai. 
b. Tashin zuciya ko amai
c. Tabo ko zubar jini a tsaka-tsaki. 
d. Ciwon nono da zafin tabi
e. Canzawar hali.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use daily pills.

Who can use
1.You can use daily pills if you want a short-term contraceptive method.
2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from six months after birth)
3. If you have irregular menstrual cycle.
4. If you don't have migrainous headaches.
5. If you are taking antibiotics, antifungal or antiparasitic medications.

A kan wanda zai iya amfani da wanda ba zai iya amfani da kwayoyin yau da kullum ba. 
  
Wanene zai iya amfani: 
1. Ana iya amfani da kwaya na yau da kullun idan kuna son tsarin hana haihuwa na ɗan gajeren lokaci. 
2. Idan kina shayarwa (daga wata shida bayan haihuwa). 
3. Idan kina da rikitacen al'ada
4. Idan baki da ciwon kai na migraine. 
5. Idan kina shan maguguna irin su antibiotic,antifungal ko antiparasite
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?

Who cannot use
1. If you are a breastfeeding mother from 6 weeks to 6 months postpartum.
2. If you are a smoker and over 35 years old.
3. If you have any of the following medical conditions, it is not advisable to take daily piils:
a. Blood Pressure
b. Venous thromboembolism
c. Stroke.
d. Heart Disease.
e. Liver Disease
f. Breast Cancer
g. Diabetes
h. Sickle-cell Anaemia

Wanda baze iya amfani ba 
1. Idan mace ce mai shayarwa daga sati shida zuwa wata shida bayan haihuwa. 
2. Idan ke mai shan taba ne kuma mai shekaru sama da talatin da shida. 
3. Idan kina da daya daga cikin wadannan yanayi na rashin lafiya, ba a so a rika shan kwayoyin  yau da kullum: 
a. Hawan jini 
b. venous thromboembolism 
c. Mutuwar barin jiki
d. Ciwon Zuciya 
e. Cutar Hanta 
f. cutar daji na nono
g. Ciwon siga
h. sikler

Levofem is a safe, low-dose, combined oral contraceptive used to prevent pregnancy. Each pack contains 21 active yellow tablets and 7 placebo(inactive) tablets which should be taken around the same time daily.

Levofem lafiyayye ne, maras nauyi, haɗe-haɗe na maganin hana haihuwa da ake amfani dashi don hana ciki. Kowace fakitin ya ƙunshi kwayar rawaya masu aiki guda 21 da kwayar placebo (marasa aiki) 7 waɗanda yakamata a sha kusan lokaci ɗaya kowace rana.
Kuna iya siyan shi a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.

Yadda Ake Amfani
1. Ɗauki kwaya ta farko daga fakitin da aka yi masa alama da daidai ranar mako, ko kwaya ta farko ta kalar farko (phasic pills)
2. Ci gaba da shan kwaya a lokaci guda kowace rana har sai an gama fakitin. Ci gaba da shan kwayoyin cuta har tsawon kwanaki bakwai (a cikin wadannan kwanaki bakwai za ku sami jini).
3. Fara fakitin kwayayen kwayaye na gaba a rana ta takwas, ko har yanzu jini na jini ko babu. Wannan ya kamata ya kasance daidai ranar mako kamar lokacin da kuka sha kwayar cutar ta farko

Dianofem is a safe and effective pill that contains a combination of an antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) and estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) used for the treatment of dermatological and gynecological conditions in women. It also prevents pregnancy. It contains 21 tablets with no placebo (inactive pills).

Dianofem kwaya ce mai aminci kuma mai inganci wacce ta ƙunshi hadin sinadarin antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) da estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) da ake amfani da su don magance cututtukan al'amuran da suka shafi mata da cuttutukan fata. Yana kuma hana ciki. Ya ƙunshi allunan 21 ba tare da placebo (kwayoyin marasa aiki).

How to Use
Take one tablet daily for 21 days, followed by a 7-day break where no tablets are taken. Start the next pack after the 7-day break.


Yadda Ake Amfani 
Ɗauki kwayar maganin guda ɗaya kowace rana tsawon kwanaki 21, sannan a yi hutu na kwanaki 7 inda ba za’a sha allunan ba. Fara fakiti na gaba bayan hutun kwanaki 7.

How to Use
One pill is taken around the same time daily for 21 days followed by a 7-day break, then continue with the next pack.


Yadda Ake Amfani 
Ana shan kwaya ɗaya kusan lokaci ɗaya kowace rana tsawon kwanaki 21 sannan a yi hutun kwanaki 7, sannan a ci gaba da fakitin na gaba. 
Za mu iya mayar da ku zuwa ga wakili / cibiyar lafiya mafi kusa.

Injectable contraceptives are a form of hormonal birth control for women. They consist of 2-3 monthly injections containing an estrogen and a progestin to prevent pregnancy.

The injection works by preventing the ovaries from releasing an egg each month. It also thickens the fluid around the cervix.

They can be used for pregnancy prevention for 1 to 3 months.

Ok, let me tell you some of the advantages and disadvantages of injectable contraceptives.

Advantages
1. They are highly effective and safe.
2. They do not interfer with sexual intercourse.
3. They can be self administered or provided by a trained non-medical personnel.
4. They protect against ectopic pregnancy.
5.They reduce symptoms of endometriosis.
6. They are convenient, easy to use and administered once in a month.


Toh, bari in gaya muku wasu fa'idodi da matsalolin na allurar rigakafin hana haihuwa. 

Fa’idodin su
1. Suna da tasiri sosai da aminci. 
2. Ba sa kutsawa cikin jima'i. 
3. Mutun na iya yi da kanshi ko kuma kwararen ma'aikacin da ba na lafiya ba zeh iya mai
4. Suna kariya daga samun cikin wajan mahaifa
5.Suna rage alamun ciwon ciki ta al’ada. 
6. Suna da sauƙin amfani da gudanarwa kuma sau ɗaya a wata a ke yin ta. "

Now to the disadvantages of injectable contraceptives.

Disadvantages
1. They require regular visit to the to the clinic (monthly)
2. Return to fertility is delayed.
3.Their commom sides effects include:
a. Weight changes.
b. Headache.
c. Dizziness.
d. Breast tenderness.
e. Mood changes.
f. Menstrual change.
g. Decreased libido.

Progesta is an injectable contraceptive, a highly safe and effective contraceptive, injected intramuscularly and sometimes into the anus for 3 months continuously. 

Its mechanism of action are
• thicken cervical mucus.
• inhibits ovulation.
• thins uterus walls to prevent ovulation.

Progesta maganin hana haihuwa ne wanda za'a iya yin allura sa, mai aminci da inganci, allurar cikin tsoka kuma wani lokacin ana yin ta a tubura har tsawon wata uku a jere

Tsarin Aiki 
• kaurara ruwan bakin mahaifa
• yana hana ovulation wato zagoyowan kwai na haihuwa. 
• siriritar da bangon mahaifa don hana ovulation.

You can visit a family planning clinic/provider if you want to adopt this method.

Audio embedding (Progesta)

Advantages of progesta include 
• Safe, highly effective, discontinued at will.
• Long-acting, 
• Provided outside the clinic, 
• Reversible, easy to use, private, and non-contraceptive benefit. 

Users include heavy smokers, thyroid disorders, diabetes, those 18 years old or younger, breastfeeding mothers, and pelvic inflammatory diseases. 

Fa'idodin sune inganci sosai, dakatarwa sanda ake so, dogon aiki, samun sa ko ba a asibiti ba, mai sauƙin amfani, ana iya an fani da shi a sirri,dawo da haihuwa in an gama,faidar hana haihuwa. Masu amfani sun haɗa da masu shan taba mai yawa,  cutar makoko, ciwon siga, shekarun 18 ko  ma yan ƙanana, uwaye masu shayarwa, cututtukan kumburin ƙashin ƙugu ko mara.

How to use 
• Injected in the upper arm or buttocks, start at any time during the menstrual cycle. 
• 5 days after menstrual period, abstain from sex for the next 7 days. 
• It can be administered after abortion. 
• Start 6 weeks after delivery for a breastfeeding woman.


Yadda ake amfani da shi 
• Ana yin allura a hannu ko duwawu, ana farawa a kowane lokaci yayin jinin haila.
• Kwanaki biyar bayan jinin al'ada, kiyaye wa jima'i na tsawon kwanaki bakwai masu zuwa. 
• Ana iya ba da ita bayan  barewar ciki. 
• am fani da ita bayan makonni 6 bayan haihuwa ga mace mai shayarwa.

A diaphragm or cap is a type of barrier contraceptive device inserted into the vagina before sex to cover the cervix so that sperm can't get into the womb (uterus). You need to use spermicide with it (spermicides kill sperm). The diaphragm must be left in place for at least 6 hours after sex. The diaphragm is a vaginal barrier contraceptive that is woman-controlled, nonhormonal, and appropriate for women who cannot or do not want to use hormonal contraceptive methods, intrauterine devices, or condoms.
Click to listen to a short introduction of diaphragm in Pidgin, if you want.
Audio embedding (Diaphragm)

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of Diaphragms.

Advantages
1. Diaphragms do not have hormones, so no side effects.
2. Good option for women who prefer non-hormonal contraceptive methods.
3. They may be fitted at any time (post-partum mothers must wait for 6 weeks after delivery or mid-trimester abortion) 
4. They can be inserted up to 6 hours before sex to avoid interruption. 
5. Only used when needed and gives the woman absolute control.
6. One size fits most women.
7. Portable and convenient - it comes with a specially designed case that is discreet and fits in a bag.
8. Easy to use - insertion and removal gets better with practice.
9. Can be used for up to 2 years with proper care.
 
 
Yanzu bari in gaya muku wasu fa'idodi da matsalolin diaphragms. 
Amfani 
1. Diaphragms ba su da  sinadarin hormone, don haka ba yadda il’la 
2. Kyakkyawan zaɓi ga matan da suka fi son hanyar hana haihuwa mara sinadarin hormone.
3. Za'a iya cire su a kowane lokaci (matan bayan haihuwa dole ne su jira makonni 6 bayan haihuwa ko zubar da ciki na tsakiyar watanni ciki) 
4. Za a iya sanya su har zuwa sa'o'i 6 kafin jima'i don kauce wa katsewa 
5. Ana amfani da ita kawai lokacin da ake buƙata kuma yana ba mace cikakken iko.  
6. Girma ɗaya kan dace da yawancin mata 
7. Maɗaukaki kuma mai dacewa - ya zo da akwati na musamman wanda ke da siri kuma karami da za a  iya sa wa cikin shi 
8. Sauƙin amfani - shigarwa da cirewa yafi kyau idan ana yawan gwaji
9. Ana iya amfani dashi har zuwa shekaru 2 tare da kulawa mai kyau. "

and 

Disadvantages
1. They are not readily available in Nigeria.
2. They may be expensive to some users.
3. The user must remember to insert the diaphragm before intercourse and keep it in place for at least 6 hours after sex (but not more than 24 hours) 
4. They require special care and storage.
5. They can cause urinary tract infections.
6. A different size of diaphragm may be required after childbirth or if a woman gains weight.
7. They can be damaged by excessive use or poor storage 

Yanzu ga illolin diaphragm. 
Illolin shi
1. Ba a samun shi  sosai a Najeriya. 
2. Suna iya zama da tsada ga wasu masu amfani. 
3. Dole ne mai amfani ya tuna ya saka diaphragm kafin saduwa da kuma ajiye shi na akalla sa'o'i 6 bayan jima'i (amma ba fiye da sa'o'i 24 ba). 
4. Suna buƙatar kulawa ta musamman da ajiya. 
5. Suna iya haifar da ciwon hanyoyin fitsari
6. Ana iya buƙatar girman diaphragm daban-daban bayan haihuwa ko kuma idan mace ta kara kiba.  Za su iya lalacewa ta hanyar amfani da yawa ko rashin ajiyar kwarai.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use diaphragms.

Who can use
1. If you want a safe and effective non-hormonal form of contraceptive.
2. If you cannot use hormonal methods of contraception for medical reasons.
3. If you are breastfeeding.
4. If you have sexual intercourse occasionally.

A kan wanda zai iya amfani da wanda ba zai iya amfani da diaphragms ba. 
Wanene zai iya amfani da shi
1. Idan kana son tsari mai aminci da inganci mara amfani da maganin hana haihuwa. 
2. Idan ba za ki iya amfani da hanyar hormonal don hana haihuwa ba saboda dalilin ciwo.
3. Idan kina shayarwa. 
4. Idan kina jima'i lokaci-lokaci.

Who cannot use
1. If you have an allergy or are sensitive to latex rubber or spermicide.
2. If you have severe uterine prolapse (when the uterus descends toward or into the vagina)
3. If have recurrent urinary tract infections.
4. If you lack facilities (soap and water) to taking care of the diaphragm.

Wanda ba zai iya amfani da shi ba 
1. Idan kina da alerji ko mai kyamar Kwaroron roba ko kwayoyyin kashe maniyyi
2. Idan kina da matsananciyar fitowar mahaifa (lokacin da mahaifar ta gangaro zuwa ko cikin farji). 
3. Idan ciwon  hanyoyin fitsari ya yawaita. 
4. Idan ba ku da kayan aiki (sabulu da ruwa) don kula da diaphragm.

Female condoms are a barrier method of contraception worn inside the vagina. They are made of thin soft plastic and have two ﬂexible rings – a removable ring at the closed end to help insertion and a fixed ring at the open end, which sits on the vulva to hold the condom in place They prevent pregnancy by stopping sperm from meeting an egg.
and one of its disadvantages is that it might make unpleasant noise during intercourse.

On who can use and who cannot use female condoms.

Who can use
1. If you want a safe and effective non-hormonal form of contraceptive.
2. If you cannot use hormonal methods of contraception for medical reasons.
3. If you have sexual intercourse occasionally.
4. If you have multiple sexual partners

A condom is a thin covering that fits over a hard penis. It decreases the risk of pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections (STIs) by stopping sperm and body fluids from passing between partners.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use implants.

Who can use
1. You can use an implant if you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 1 to 3 years.
2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from 6 weeks after birth)
3. If you cannot tolerate estrogen.
4. If you don't have migrainous headaches.
5. If you have endometrial or ovarian cancer, you can still use this method.

"Akan wanda zai iya amfani da wanda ba zai iya amfani da alluran hana haihuwa ba. 
Wanene zai iya amfani da shi
1. Zaki iya amfani da allurar roba idan kina son hana shigar ciki tsawon shekara daya zuwa uku.
2. Idan kina shayarwa (daga sati 6 bayan haihuwa) 
3. Idan ba za ku iya estrorn ba. 
4. Idan baki da ciwon kai na migraine. 
5. Idan kinada ciwon daji na mahaifa koh kwayayen haihuwa,zaki iya anfani da shi. "

Disadvantages
1. Insertion and removal involve minor surgery and must be performed by a trained professional.
2. You cannot discontinue the method by yourself.
3. They might have some side effects such as:
a. Headache.
b. Nausea or vomiting.
c. Dizziness.
d. Breast tenderness.
e. Weight gain.
f. Menstrual changes.
g. Spotting and irregular vaginal bleeding.

Who cannot use You cannot use implants if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Uncontrolled hypertension. b. Venous thromboembolism. c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease. f. Breast Cancer. g. Kidney infection. h. Vaginal bleeding.

Jadelle is a contraceptive implant that consists of two small flexible rods (as short as a match stick but thinner) that is inserted under the skin of a woman’s upper arm. It contains 75mg of the hormone Levonorgestrel in each rod. Jadelle implants are over 99% effective and can prevent pregnancy for a period of 5 years.

This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases very low dose of hormone which leaves the body quickly when removed, so the woman can get pregnant without delay.

"Jadelle shine dasa allura na hana haifuwa wanda ya ƙunshi ƙananan sanduna masu sassauƙa guda biyu (kamar gajeriyar sandar ashana amma sirara) waɗanda ake sakawa a ƙarƙashin fatar hannun mace. Ya ƙunshi 75mg na hormone Levonorgestrel a kowace sanda. Jadelle implants sun fi 99% tasiri kuma suna iya hana ciki na tsawon shekaru biyar. 
Wannan hanyar tana iya jujjuyawa gaba maganin kuma cikin sauri saboda tana fitar da ƙaramin adadin hormone wanda ke barin jiki da sauri idan an cire shi, don haka mace zata iya samun ciki ba tare da bata lokaci ba. "
You can visit a family planning clinic/provider if you want to adopt this method.

Implanon NXT is a contraceptive implant that consists of one small flexible rod that is inserted under the skin of a woman’s upper arm. It contains 65mg of the hormone Etonorgestrel in each rod. Implanon NXT is over 99% effective and can prevent pregnancy for 3 years. Also, it can be stopped anytime the woman wants by asking a health provider to remove it. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases a very low dose of hormone, which leaves the body quickly when removed, so you woman can get pregnant without delay.

"Implanon NXT wata irin allura ce na hana haihuwa wanda ya ƙunshi ƙaramin allura mai sassauƙa guda ɗaya wanda ake sakawa a ƙarƙashin fatar hannun mace. Ya ƙunshi 65mg na sinadirai etonorgestrel a kowace allurar.
 
Implanon NXT yana da tasiri sama da 99% kuma yana iya hana ciki har tsawon shekaru uku. Har ila yau, ana iya dakatar da shi a duk lokacin da mace ta so, ta hanyar neman ma'aikacin lafiya ya cire shi.
 
Wannan hanyar tana jujjuyawa gaba ɗaya kuma cikin sauri saboda tana fitar da kanan sinadarai, wanda ke barin jiki da sauri idan an cire shi, don haka mace za ta iya samun ciki ba tare da bata lokaci ba."

Some of its common side effects are
• Headaches.
• Dizziness.
• Breast tenderness.
• Nausea
• Stomach cramping/bloating.
• Weight gain.
• Vaginal irritation/discharge may occur.
If you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 3 - 4 years, it is advisable to adopt long-acting reversible contraception or LARC methods.

Long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC are: 1. The Injectables. 2. The Implants. 3. The IUS. 4. The IUD
While the short-acting methods are: 1. The daily contraceptive Pills. 2. The emergency contraceptive pills. 3. The barrier contraceptives
Choose any them from the options to get the full details about them.
You can still adopt the short-acting family planning methods or the barrier contraceptives if you don't want any device insertion into your body.

Intrauterine system (IUS) are hormonal intrauterine device (IUD). They contain Levenorgestrel for the treatment of some gynecological conditions (endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial hyperplasia, etc.) and pregnancy prevention. It has contraceptive coverage for up to 5 years.

How they work 

For pregnancy prevention, it works by thickening the mucus in the cervix to stop sperm from fertilizing an egg. It also thins out the lining of the uterus and suppresses ovulation and for gynaecological conditions, it reduces the endometrial lining of the womb making the period lighter and less painful.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUS.

Advantages
For pregnancy prevention:
1. No daily use is required.
2. Insertion and removal can be done at any time within the menstrual cycle.
3. Do not require regular clinic visits.
4. It has a quick return to fertility after removal.
5. Safe for breastfeeding mothers from six weeks after delivery.
6. Local release of the home ensures milder side effects.
7. It maintains normal libido.
8. Reduces the risk of ovarian cancer and endometrial cancer.
9. Lower overall risk of ectopic pregnancy than women not on contraception.

For gynecological use:
1. Starts working within 24 hours after insertion.
2. Highly effective for the treatment of abnormally heavy menstrual bleeding.
3. Lowers the risk of anemia due to menstrual blood loss.
4. Effective alternative to surgery especially for women who cannot afford to pay for surgery.
Click to listen to a short explanation of IUS in Pidgin, if you want to.
Audio embedding (Hormonal IUS)
This means that you can use IUS for both gynecological matters and to prevent pregnancy.

Now to the disadvantages of IUS.

Disadvantages
1. Your periods may become irregular or stop completely, which may not be suitable for some people.
2. Self-limiting follicular cysts may develop in the first few cycles.
3. If you get an infection when you have an IUS fitted, it could lead to a pelvic infection if it's not treated.
4. In rare cases, an IUS can make a hole in the womb when it's put in.
5. They might have some side effects such as:
a. Headache.
b. Nausea or vomiting.
c. Breast tenderness.
d. Lower abdominal cramps.
e. Irregular uterine/vaginal bleeding.

"Yanzu ga matsalolin tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa.
Illolin amfani da IUS 
1. Al'adar jinin ku na iya tsalle ke wa ko kuma ta daina gaba daya, wanda ba zai dace da wasu ba. 
2. Follicular cysts ke nan ciwowuka a mahaifa na iya tasowa a farkon al’ada. 
3. Idan ka kamu da cuta lokacin da aka sanya tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa, zai iya haifar da ciwon mara idan ba a kula da shi ba. 
4. A lokuta masu wuya, IUS na iya yin rami a cikin mahaifa lokacin da aka sanya shi. 
  
5. Suna iya haifar da illa kamar: 
a. Ciwon kai. 
b. Tashin zuciya ko amai. 
c. Ciwon nono 
d. Ciwon mara 
e. Zubar da jini na mahaifa/farji mara ka'ida. "

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use IUS.

Who can use
1. You can use IUS if you cannot use combined contraceptives.
2. If can use IUS even if you are HIV positive.

"A kan wanda zai iya amfani da wanda ba zai iya amfani da tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa ba. 
Wanene zai iya amfani da shi

2. Za ku iya amfani da tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa ko da kuna da HIV. "

Who cannot use
You cannot use IUS if you have any of the following medical conditions.
a. Uncontrolled hypertension.
b. Stroke.
c. Heart Disease.
d. Liver Disease.
e. Breast Cancer.
f. Cervical cancer.
g. Kidney infection.
h. Unexplained vaginal bleeding

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUD.

Advantages
1. IUDs are highly effective and safe for a majority of women.
2. They are 100% hormone-free, so no hormonal side effects.
3. Can be removed at any time with immediate return to fertility.
4. Can be used as an emergency contraceptive if inserted within 5 days of having unprotected sex.
5. They are private and independent of intercourse.
6. They are long-lasting and can prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years with no drug interaction.

"Yanzu bari in gaya muku wasu fa'idodi da matsalolin tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa

Amfani 
1. IUDs suna da tasiri sosai kuma suna da lafiya ga yawancin mata. 
2. Suna da tabacin rashin sinadarin jiki, don haka babu wani sakamako na sinadaran
3. Za a iya cirewa a kowane lokaci tare da komawa zuwa haihuwa nan da nan. 
4. Za a iya amfani da shi azaman maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa idan an saka shi cikin kwanaki biyar da yin jima'i ba tare da kariya ba. 
5. Suna da sirri ne kuma masu zaman kansu ba tare da jima'i ba. 
6. Suna da karko kuma suna iya hana daukar ciki har zuwa shekaru goma ba tare da mu'amala da kwayoyi ba. "

Now to the disadvantages of IUD.

Disadvantages
Complications are rare but may occur and they include;
1. Expulsion of IUD, which may lead to pregnancy.
2. Uterine perforation.
3. They might cause some side effects such as:
a. Irregular and heavy period or bleeding.
b. Menstrual cramps.
c. Abnormal vaginal discharge.

"Yanzu ga matsalolin tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa
Illolin su
Matsalolin amfani da su na da wuyan kasance, amma suna iya faruwa kamar haka; 
1. Fashe war tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa, wanda zai iya haifar da ciki. 
2. Hujewar mahaifa.
3. Suna iya haifar da wasu matsaloli na gefe kamar: 
a. Zubar da jini na mahaifa/farji mara ka'ida. 
b. Ciwon ciki ta haila. 
c. Fitar majina marar kyau da ga farji  "

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use IUD.

Who can use
1. You can use an IUD if you are very sexually active.
2. You can use an IUD even if you are a breastfeeding mother, a smoker, or have diabetes and hypertension.
3. You can use an IUD if you have currently or history of certain health conditions like stroke, heart disease, liver disease, breast cancer, headaches, lupus, vein thrombosis, etc, and cannot use hormonal contraceptives.
4. You can use an IUD even if you are taking drugs like anti-tuberculosis drugs, anti-convulsant drugs, or anti-retroviral agents, etc.

Who cannot use You cannot use an IUD if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Cervical cancer. b. Endometrial disease. c. Unexplained vaginal bleeding. d. Uterine fibroid with cavity distortion. e. Pelvic tuberculosis. f. Untreated vaginal infection. g. STIs like gonorrhoea and chlamydia.
So do you currently have or previously had any of the medical conditions listed?

Permanent family planning methods means the person will no longer be able to reproduce again. 

Male: Vasectomy
Female: Tubal ligation

Click on any of them to get a short explanation on them.
Tubal Litigation

Vasectomy is a form of male birth control that cuts the supply of sperm to your semen.
It's done by cutting and sealing the tubes that carry sperm.

Vasectomy has a low risk of problems and can usually be performed in an outpatient setting under local anesthesia.

You will need to consult a health care provider.

"Vasectomy wani nau'i ne na hana haihuwa na namiji wanda ke yanke wadatar da maniyyi. 
Ana yin shi ta hanyar yankewa da rufe bututun da ke ɗauke da maniyyi. Vasectomy yana da ƙananan haɗari na matsaloli kuma yawanci ana iya yin shi a wurin marasa lafiya a ƙarƙashin maganin sa barci. 

Kuna buƙatar tuntuɓar likita. "

Tubal Litigation is surgery women can get to "tie" their fallopian tubes. It's a type of female sterilization. The goal is to prevent eggs from travelling from the ovaries to the uterus so you can't get pregnant.

Tubal ligation tiyata ce akewa mata dan daure kafofin dake fitar da kwan haibuwa. Manufar ita ce hana ƙwai tafiya daga ma'ajiyar su zuwa mahaifa, don haka ba za ku iya yin ciki ba.

Some of its common side effects are:
a. Abdominal pain or cramping.
b. Fatigue.
c. Dizziness.
d. Gassiness or bloating.
e. Shoulder pain.

You will need to consult a health care provider

Kuna buƙatar tuntuɓar likita."

If more than 72 hours (3 days) have passed since unprotected sex, it won't be effective. In such a situation, kindly consult a healthcare provider as soon as possible to explore other options.  It's essential not to delay seeking medical advice in such cases to address any potential risks.

An IUD (Intrauterine Device) is a small T or Y-shaped contraceptive device inserted into the uterus to prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years. They are usually called Copper T or Copper Y.

They are long-lasting, easily reversible, safe, and more than 99% effective in preventing unintended pregnancy.

They work by providing an environment that is toxic and hostile for the sperm thereby preventing them from fertilizing an egg.
Danna don sauraron ɗan bayani game da IUD a cikin Pidgin, idan kuna so.

"A kan wanda zai iya amfani da wanda ba zai iya amfani da tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa
ba. 
Wanene zai iya amfani da shi 
1.Zaka iya amfani da tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa
idan kana yawan jima'i. 
2. Zaki iya amfani da tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa koda kuwa uwa ce mai shayarwa, mai shan taba, mai ciwon suga da hawan jini. 
3. Kuna iya amfani da tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa
 idan a baya ko a halin yanzu kina fama da wasu yanayi na kiwon lafiya kamar mutuwar barin jiki, cututtukan zuciya, cututtukan hanta, ciwon daji nono, ciwon kai, lupus, thrombosis na jijiya da sauransu kuma ba za ku iya amfani da maganin hana haihuwa. 
4. Kuna iya amfani da tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa ko da kuna shan kwayoyi kamar maganin tarin fuka, magungunan jijigan jiki ko magungunan cutar kanjamau da dai sauransu. "

"Wanda ba zai iya amfani da shi ba: 
Ba za ki iya amfani da  tsarin iyalin cikin mahaifa  ba idan kina da ɗayan daga cikin waɗannan cututtuka masu zuwa. 
a. Ciwon dajin bakin mahaifa
b. ciwon cikin mahaifa
c. Jinin farji mara dalili 
d. Uterine fibroids tare da kaucewar mahaifa
e. cutar tarin fuka daya shafi mara
f. Ciwon farji da ba a sha magani ba 
g.  Cutar saduwa kamar gonorrhea da chlamydia. "
Don haka a halin yanzu kina da koh kin taba yin ɗaya daga cikin yanayin cututtukar da na lissafa?
Kuna iya danna sautin da ke ƙasa don sauraron a taƙaitaccen gabatarwar Postpill a cikin pidgin, idan kuna so.
Yawwa, bari in nuna muku ɗaya daga cikin ingantattun samfuran IUD waɗanda zaki iya amfani da.

Na'urorin Lydia IUD ba na hormonal ba ne, maganin hana haihuwa na dogon lokaci (shekaru biyar zuwa goma) DKT yana da bambance-bambancen guda 5 waɗanda zasu iya zuwa a siffan T (mafi yawanci) ko a siffan Y  - Anyi ta da rigar roba tare da jan karfe. Ana shigar da wannan na'urar a cikin mahaifa kuma ita ce mafi inganci ta hanyar hana haihuwa a cewar WHO tare da kusan kashi 99.9% na inganci. Hakanan zai iya zama maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa idan aka yi amfani da shi a cikin kwanaki biyar bayan jima'i marar kariya. Hanyar aikin shi shine hana shigar da maniyyi saboda gubar jan karfe ga maniyyi

"Yanzu bari in gaya muku wasu fa'idodi da matsalolin tsarin iyalin na cikin mahaifa.
Amfani su
Don rigakafin ciki:  
1. Ba a buƙatar amfani kullun. 
2. Ana iya sawa da cirewa a kowane lokaci a cikin al'ada. 
3. Baya bukatan ziyartar asibiti akai-akai. 
4. Yana da saurin dawowa da haihuwa bayan cirewa 
5. Lafiya ga iyaye mata masu shayarwa daga makonni shida bayan haihuwa. 
6. Sakin sinadaran na haifar da illa mai sauki
7. Yana kiyaye sha'awa.
8. Yana rage haɗarin ciwon dajin mahaifa da kwayayen haihuwa.
9. Rage cikin bayan mahaifa fiye ga da mata da ba sa shan magani tsarin iyali. 
Don amfani a batutuwan da suka shafi mata: 
1. Fara aiki a cikin sa'o'i 24 bayan sakawa. 
2. Mai matukar tasiri wajen magance matsalar zubar jinin haila mai yawa. 
3. Yana rage haɗarin cutar rashin jinni saboda zubar jinin haila. 
4. Matakin da ya darra tiyata musamman ga matan da ba za su iya biyan kuɗin aikin tiyata ba. "

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of contraceptive implants.

Advantages
1. They can be used at any time in the menstrual cycle, are very effective, and are removed whenever you want to get pregnant.
2. It gives total privacy, no one will know you have it and does not interfere with sex.
3. No frequent clinical follow-up is needed after initial insertion.
4. It is estrogen-free so many people can use it
5. They are long-acting and may help prevent ectopic pregnancy.
6. Does not disturb breast milk production.
7. There is no delay in return to fertility when they are removed.
Click to listen to a short explanation of implants in Pidgin, if you want to.
Click here if you want to know the advantages and disadvantages of Implants

Contraceptive implants are small, flexible rods inserted under the skin, typically in the arm. They release hormones (usually progestin) to prevent pregnancy.

They are long-term birth control methods also called long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC. They provide contraception, lasting up to 3 - 5 years but can be removed at any time.

They work by preventing the release of egg and thickening the cervical mucus making it difficult for sperm to reach the egg.

Toh. "

Me kake son yi a gaba?

Kwayoyin yau da kullun kwayoyine na hana haihuwa,na cutar fata ,da batutuwan da suka shafi mata, da kula da rashin daidaituwa na al'ada(jini mai nauyi,jinin haila mai radadi,ciwon fara al'ada)
Suna yin aiki ne ta hanyar sa kauri a kusa da mahaifa wanda ke sa maniyyi wahalar shiga cikin mahaifa kuma ya hana kowane ƙwai da aka saki ya hadu da maniyyi. 
Yawancin kwayoyin yau da kullun na tsarin iyali suna zuwa ko dai fakitin kwanaki 21 (Dianofem da Desofem) ko fakitin kwanaki 28 (Levofem). Ana shan kwaya daya a kowace rana kusan lokaci guda har tsawon kwanaki 21. Ya danganta da fakitin ku, zaku sami hutu na kwanaki 7 (kamar yadda yake cikin fakitin kwanaki 21) ko kuma ku sha kwayar da ke ɗauke da Iron na tsawon kwanaki 7 (fakitin kwanaki 28).

Yanzu bari na fada muku wasu fa'idodi da matsalolin kwayoyin yau da kullun
  
Amfani Su
1. Suna da tasiri sosai idan aka yi amfani da su daidai. 
2. Mafi aminci ga yawancin mata. 
3. Komawa zuwa haihuwa yana da sauri sosai. 
4. Yana daidaita al'ada, yana rage yawan zubar jinin haila da rage radadin haila da fitar kwai
5. Suna da sauƙin amfani.

and Disadvantages
1. They must be taken daily which might be difficult to comply with.
2. They might cause mild and temporary side effect which usually goes away after some weeks such as:
a. Mild headache.
b. Nausea or vomiting.
c. Spotting or bleeding at intervals.
d. Breast tenderness and soreness to touch.
e. Mood changes.

Danna kowane ɗayansu don samun cikakkun bayanansu.

How to Use
1. Take your first pill from the packet marked with the correct day of the week, or the first pill of the first colour (phasic pills)
2. Continue to take a pill at the same time each day until the pack is finished. Continue taking pills for seven days (during these seven days you will get a bleed).
3. Start your next pack of pills on the eighth day, whether you are still bleeding or not. This should be the same day of the week as when you took your first pill
You can buy Levofem at any pharmacy or health store around you.

<font style="font-size: 10px;">Diaphragm wani nau'in na'urar hana daukar ciki ne da ake sakawa a cikin farji kafin yin jima'i don rufe mahaifar mahaifa ta yadda maniyyi ba zai iya shiga cikin mahaifa ba. Kuna buƙatar amfani da man kashe maniyyi da shi (magungunan su na kashe maniyyi). Dole ne a bar diaphragm a wurin na akalla sa'o'i 6 bayan jima'i. Diaphragm shine maganin hana haihuwa na farji wanda mace kan iya sarrafawa, ba na hormonal ba, kuma ya dace da matan da ba za su iya ko ba sa so su yi amfani da hanyoyin hana haihuwa  masu sinadarin hormone, na'urorin ciki, ko kwaroron roba. </font>

Koma zuwa babban menu
Koyi game da wasu hanyoyin
Me kake son yi a gaba?
Kina iya danna nan don kallon bidiyo akan yadda ake sakawa da cire diaphragm da yadda ake amfani da gel a diaphragm a cikin pidgin.
Kuna iya siyan shi a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.
Toh, bari in nuna muku yadda diaphragm yake kama da yadda ake amfani da shi.

Kwaroron roba na mata hanya ce ta hana daukar ciki da ake sawa a cikin farji. An yi su da roba siriri mai laushi kuma suna da zobba masu sassauƙa guda biyu - zobe mai cirewa a ƙarshen rufe don taimakawa sakawa da zoben a ƙarshen buɗewa, wanda ke zaune akan farji don riƙe kwaroron roba da kyau. Suna hana ciki ta hanyar dakatar da maniyyi daga  saduwa da kwan ciki.

Wasu fa'idodinsa sune: 
1. Ba a buƙatar takardar sayan magani. 
2. Kwaroron roba na mata suna da yawa. 
3.  Basu da illa.
4. Suna kariya daga wasu cututtuka da ake kamuwa da su ta hanyar jima'i. 
5. Suna da arha. 
6. Mace na iya sarrafa shi wurin amfani kuma ana amfani dashi kawai lokacin da ake buƙata.
kuma daya daga cikin illarsa shine yana kara mara dadi yayin saduwa

Akan wanda zai iya amfani da wanda ba zai iya amfani da kwaroron roba na mata ba. 
Wanene zai iya amfani da shi
1. Idan kina son tsari mai aminci da inganci mara amfani da maganin hana haihuwa. 
2. Idan baza ki iya amfani da tsarin iyali meh sinadarin hormone ba saboda wani ciwon.
3. Idan kina jima'i lokaci-lokaci. 
4. Idan kina saduwa da mutane daban daban.
Sannan idan ki nada fitar al'aura ko mahaifa (lokacin da  mahaifar ta sauko zuwa cikin farji), ba za ka iya amfani da kwaroron roba na mace ba.
Toh, bari in nuna muku yadda kwaroron roba na mace yake da kuma yadda ake amfani da shi
Kuna iya danna don kallon bidiyo akan yadda ake sakawa da cire kwaroron roba na mace a cikin Pidgin.
Kuna iya siyan shi a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.

Kwaroron roba murfin bakin ciki ne wanda ya dace da azzakari. Yana rage haɗarin ciki da cututtukan da ake ɗauka ta hanyar jima'i (STIs) ta hanyar dakatar da maniyyi da ruwan jiki daga wucewa tsakanin abokan tarayya.
Kuna iya danna sautin don sauraron yadda ake sakawa da cire kwaroron roba daidai a cikin Pidgin idan kuna so.

Bari in gaya muku wasu ingantattun kwaroron roba da ake da su.

Danna kowane ɗayansu don samun cikakkun bayanansu

Fiesta babbar kampanin kwaroron roba ce wacce ta zo cikin bambance-bambancen salo har sha hudu masu ban sha'awa na salo, launuka, laushi, dandano, siffofi da girma waɗanda ke ƙara jin daɗin a lokacin jima’i.
 
1. Suna bada babbar kariya daga da ga cuttar kanjamau
2. Bambance-bambancen ban sha'awa suna ba da ingantacciyar jin daɗin jima'i ga ma'aurata.
3. Tabbatar kariya da ga ciwon sanyi/kanjamau ga mata akan wasu hanyoyin tsarin iyali ko hana haihuwa.
4. Za a iya amfani da shi wajen jima'i ta baka, dubura da farji.
5. An gwada ta ta hanyar lantarki da ƙera don saduwa kuma ta ammunce a duk duniya.

Allurar na aiki ne ta hanyar hana sakin kwai kowane wata. Yana kuma kaurara ruwan da ke kusa da bakin mahaifa.

Ana iya amfani da su don rigakafin ciki har tsawon watanni daya zuwa uku.

I had unprotected sex recently. What do I do to avoid pregnancy?

To avoid pregnancy after unprotected sex, you can take emergency contraceptive pills.

Emergency contraceptive pills are taken immediately after unprotected sex to prevent pregnancy.

Emergency pills are very effective when taken within 24 to 72 hours after unprotected sex. You are advised to not take it more than 3 times in a month. If you are ovulating, you should use an alternative contraceptive plan (condoms).

Please note that they are not effective if you are already pregnant.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available emergency contraceptive pills.

Postpill can be taken within 5 days after sex, while Postinor2 is effective within 3 days.

Which product do you want to learn about?

Allright. I am happy to provide you with more information about family planning methods that are effective and safe for you.

For how long do you want to prevent pregnancy?


"Da kyau. Ina farin cikin ba ka ƙarin bayani game da hanyoyin tsara iyali da suke da amfani kuma ba su da haɗari a gare ka.

Har yaushe kake son hana daukar ciki?"

Short Term
(up to 1 year)

Long Term
(1 year to permanent)

The short-term family planning methods are:

1. Daily contraceptive pills
2. The barrier contraceptives which are the diaphragms and Condoms
3. Injectables.

Click on any of them to get the full details about them.

 
Hanyoyin tsarin iyali na gajeren lokaci sune: 
1. Kwayoyin hana haihuwa na yau da kullun 
2. Magungunan rigakafin gaggawa 
3. Abubuwan hana daukar ciki wadanda sune diaphragms da kwaroron roba sai kuma allurai na hana haihuwa. 
 
Danna kowane ɗayansu don samun cikakkun bayanai game da su.
For how long do you want to prevent pregnancy?

Postpill is a one-dose emergency contraceptive pill by DKT. It contains 1.5 mg Levongestrel. POSTPILL should be taken orally as soon as possible within 24 hours but can still be taken within 5 days (120 hours) of unprotected sex.

You can buy Postpill at any pharmacy or health store around you.

Postpill shine maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa na kashi ɗaya na DKT. Ya ƙunshe 1.5 MG Levongestrel. POSTPILL yakamata a sha shi da wuri cikin sa'o'i 24 zuwa kwanaki 5 (awa 120) bayan jima’i  ba tare da tsaro ba.

Kuna iya siyan maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa wato postpill a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.

Postinor is an Emergency Contraceptive Pill (ECP) that safely prevents unwanted pregnancy within 72 hours after unprotected sexual intercourse.

It doesn’t work if you are already pregnant and will not harm an already established pregnancy. The sooner you take POSTINOR, the more effective it is.

You can buy Postinor at any pharmacy or health store around you.


POSTINOR Kwaya ce ta gaggawa ta hana daukar ciki (ECP) wacce ke hana daukar ciki a cikin sa'o'i 72 bayan jima'i ba tare da kariya ba. 
Ba ya aiki idan an riga an samu shigar ciki kuma ba zai cutar da ciki da aka rigaya aka samu ba. Shan POSTINOR da wuri bayan jima’in, yafi inganci.

Kuna iya siyan shi a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.
Daily contraceptive pills
Male Condom

Daily pills are combined oral contraceptive (COC) pills for pregnancy prevention, dermatological and gynecological conditions, and management of menstrual irregularities (heavy bleeding, painful menstruation, premenstrual syndrome).
They work by thickening the mucus around the cervix, which makes it difficult for sperm to enter the uterus and reach any eggs that may have been released.
Daily pills are either a 21-day pack (Dianofem and Desofem) or a 28-day pack (Levofem). One pill is taken each day at about the same time for 21 days. Depending on your pack, you will either have a 7-day break (as in the 21-day pack) or you will take the pill that contains Iron for 7 days (the 28-day pack).

Click to listen to a short introduction of daily pills in Pidgin, if you want to. 

Danna don sauraron gajeren gabatarwa na kwayoyi na yau da kullun a cikin Pidgin, idan kuna so.
Audio embedding (Daily pills)

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of daily pills includes.

Advantages

1. They are very effective if used correctly.
2. Very safe for the majority of women.
3. Return to fertility is very fast.
4. They regularize the menstrual cycle, reduce heavy menstrual flow, and reduce menstrual and ovulation pain.
5. They are simple and easy to use.

Yanzu ga matsalolin kwayoyin yau da kullun
Matsalolin su
1. Dole ne a sha su kullum wanda zai yi wahala a bi shi. 
2. Suna iya haifar da lahani na dan lokaci wanda yawanci ke wucewa bayan wasu makonni kamar;
a. Ciwon kai. 
b. Tashin zuciya ko amai
c. Tabo ko zubar jini a tsaka-tsaki. 
d. Ciwon nono da zafin tabi
e. Canzawar hali.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use daily pills.

Who can use
1.You can use daily pills if you want a short-term contraceptive method.
2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from six months after birth)
3. If you have irregular menstrual cycle.
4. If you don't have migrainous headaches.
5. If you are taking antibiotics, antifungal or antiparasitic medications.

A kan wanda zai iya amfani da wanda ba zai iya amfani da kwayoyin yau da kullum ba. 
  
Wanene zai iya amfani: 
1. Ana iya amfani da kwaya na yau da kullun idan kuna son tsarin hana haihuwa na ɗan gajeren lokaci. 
2. Idan kina shayarwa (daga wata shida bayan haihuwa). 
3. Idan kina da rikitacen al'ada
4. Idan baki da ciwon kai na migraine. 
5. Idan kina shan maguguna irin su antibiotic,antifungal ko antiparasite
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?

Who cannot use
1. If you are a breastfeeding mother from 6 weeks to 6 months postpartum.
2. If you are a smoker and over 35 years old.
3. If you have any of the following medical conditions, it is not advisable to take daily piils:
a. Blood Pressure
b. Venous thromboembolism
c. Stroke.
d. Heart Disease.
e. Liver Disease
f. Breast Cancer
g. Diabetes
h. Sickle-cell Anaemia

Wanda baze iya amfani ba 
1. Idan mace ce mai shayarwa daga sati shida zuwa wata shida bayan haihuwa. 
2. Idan ke mai shan taba ne kuma mai shekaru sama da talatin da shida. 
3. Idan kina da daya daga cikin wadannan yanayi na rashin lafiya, ba a so a rika shan kwayoyin  yau da kullum: 
a. Hawan jini 
b. venous thromboembolism 
c. Mutuwar barin jiki
d. Ciwon Zuciya 
e. Cutar Hanta 
f. cutar daji na nono
g. Ciwon siga
h. sikler

Ok, it is not advisable for you to take daily pills. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraceptive.
