What kind of concerns do you have?

IUDs are very effective in preventing pregnancy (>99%).

If you would like to discuss it  in more details with a medical professional, please call 7790.

The IUD does not have any negative effects on your health. 

If you're still worried about the IUD and its effects on your health, it's important to talk to a healthcare provider.

They can provide personalized advice and address any concerns you may have.

We understand some methods could get too costly.

Please call 7790 and a medical professional will help you to find a more affordable solution.

The IUD is very convenient to use.

If you are experiencing any form of discomfort, kindly call 7790 for free to speak to a nurse.

Complications are rare but may occur and they include:
1. Expulsion of IUD, which may lead to pregnancy.
2. Uterine perforation.

They might cause some side effects such as:
a. Irregular and heavy period or bleeding.
b. Menstrual cramps.
c. Abnormal vaginal discharge.

Normally, they wear out after a few weeks. If your symptoms are not mentioned above or you are still worried, please visit your family planning provider.

Complications like that are rare, but possible.

Please call 7790 so medical professional will help to find a better solution.
There is nothing to be ashamed when doing family planning. Moreover, with the IUD, no one will know you are using it.
The IUD method is safe and you can have more children when you stop using it. It is possible almost immediately.
If you're seeking a contraceptive method that doesn't require clinic involvement, there are a few to consider: Some Injection, Pills, and Condoms.
What kind of concerns do you have?
Implants are very effective in preventing pregnancy. If you would like to discuss it in more details with a medical professional, please call 7790.
People with some health conditions are advised against the use of the Implants.  Please seek counsel from your health provider before use.

We understand some methods could get too costly.

Please call 7790 for free and a medical professional will help you to find a more affordable solution.

The Implant is very convenient to use.

If you are experiencing any form of discomfort, kindly call 7790 for free to speak to a medical professional.

Complications are rare but may occur and they include;
a. Headache.
b. Nausea or vomiting.
c. Dizziness.
d. Breast tenderness.
e. Weight gain.
f. Menstrual changes.
g. Spotting and irregular vaginal bleeding. 

Normally, they wear out after a few weeks. If your symptoms are not mentioned above or you are still worried, please visit your family planning provider.
The Implant is not affecting your sexual life except for dryness. We recommend using a water-based lubricant.
There is nothing to be ashamed when doing family planning. Moreover, with the Implant, no one will know you are doing family planning.

The Implant method is safe and you can have more children when you stop using it. 
Once you stop using the IUD you can get pregnant almost immediately.
If you're seeking a contraceptive method that doesn't require clinic involvement, there are a few to consider: Some Injection, Pill, and Condoms.

The most effective methods are the Implants and IUD

Other effective methods are the pills and diaphragm and the least effective methods you can use are the condoms, abstinence from sex on fertile days, and the withdrawal method.

Okay, I see.

The most effective methods for quick return to fertility are Implants and IUD.

Other effective methods are Daily Pills and Diaphragm and the least effective methods you can use are the condoms, abstinence from sex on fertile days, and the withdrawal method.

The effects of contraceptive methods on sex life can vary depending on individual experiences and preferences.

Some methods, like hormonal contraceptives (such as birth control pills, patches, or IUDs), may have side effects like changes in libido, mood swings, or dryness.

However, these effects are not universal, and many individuals use contraceptives without experiencing negative impacts on their sex lives.


Other non-hormonal methods like condoms or copper IUDs typically don't affect libido.
Ultimately, it's essential to discuss any concerns or potential side effects with a healthcare provider to find the best option that suits your needs and lifestyle.

OK. When you are picking a contraceptive methods, what are the things that are important to you? 
O DARA. Nígbà ti o ba n mu àwọn ìlànà idena oyún kan, kini àwọn nnkan ti o ṣe pàtàkì fun ọ?

3 to 4 years

Ok, if you do not want to gain weight, the most effective method to adopt is the IUD.

Other method to adopt is the Diaphragm and the least effective methods you can use are the condoms, abstinence from sex on fertile days, and the withdrawal method.

The methods that are completely painless are the condoms and diaphrams but they are not as effective as the injectibles, implants and the IUDs. With the injectibles and implants, most people do not experience side effects but some people experience mild headaches. With the IUDs most people do not experience any discomfort after insertion but some people report mild abdominal pain.

 Jẹ ko yé ọ daju pé ìlànà yìí jẹ èyí ti ṣise iṣẹ rẹ kere jùlọ nínú gbogbo wọn. Ti o ba nilo alaye sii lori awọn ilana ifètò ṣọmọ bibi miiran, jọwọ pe 7790.
O ko nilo lati ṣe ohunkohun. Sugbọn ti o ba nilo lati bí ọmọ síi, ríi dájú pé o gba àlàyé kíkún láti ọdọ oníṣègùn ìlera rẹ.

Irú àwọn ifiyesi wo lóni?

O dára bẹẹ            
Jẹ ki n bèèrè àwọn ìbéèrè diẹ lati ni oye daradara lọwọ rẹ, kini iru ilana ti yoo dara julọ fun ọ.
O dára, jẹ ki n beere lọwọ rẹ awọn ibeere diẹ lati ni oye daradara kini iru ilana ti yoo dara fun ọ.
Se o fẹ bi omọ sii tàbí oo fẹ bí mọ síi mọ? | Ṣe iwọ yoo fẹ lati bi ọmọ miiran tabi iwọ yoo fẹ lati ma bimọ mọ?

Àwọn ìlànà ti o ṣiṣẹ dáadáa jùlọ ni awọn Ilana Alapa àti òní kọili.
Àwọn ìlànà miiran ti a tún le lo ni, alabẹrẹ, òògùn ojoojumọ àti daafuramu.

Nitooto/Patapata
 Gbogbo awọn àsàyàn ilana yii ni a yan lati fún ọ ni aabo ati ilera.

Ninu gbogbo àwọn ìlànà ti o rọrun lati lo, ìlànà ti o munadoko julọ ni awọn ifetosomobibi alapa.

 Àwọn ìlànà ti o tún rọrun miiran lati gba ni Àwọn Alabẹrẹ ati Awọn Oògùn.

 Ìlànà ti o kere julọ (ṣugbọn sibẹ 99%) ti o le lo ni Àwọn Kondomu.

Àwọn ìlànà ti ko ni irora patapata ni àwọn kondomu àti awọn daafuramu ṣugbọn wọn ko munadoko bi àwọn alabẹrẹ, àwọn onigbigbin sára àti àwọn iṣeto ifibọ ile ọmọ. Pẹlu àwọn alabẹrẹ àti àwọn onigbigbin sára, ọpọlọpọ àwọn ènìyàn ko ni iriri àwọn ìpalára ṣugbọn àwọn ènìyàn diẹ ni iriri àwọn ẹfọri kekere.  Pẹlu àwọn Iṣeto Ifibọ ile ọmọ ọpọlọpọ ènìyàn ko ni iriri ìnira kankan lẹhin ifibọ ṣugbọn àwọn ènìyàn diẹ ni irora ikun kekere.

Àwọn ìpalára ti awọn ìlànà adèna oyún lori igbe ayé ibalopọ le yatọ si ará wọn, o da lori awọn iriri ati àwọn irufẹ ẹni kọọkan.

 Diẹ ninu àwọn ilana, bii àwọn idena oyún homonu (bii àwọn oogun iṣakoso ibimọ, abulẹ, tàbí awọn IUDs), le ni àwọn ìpalára bi awọn ayipada nilibido, àwọn iyipada iṣesi, tàbí gbigbẹ.

 Sibẹsibẹ, àwọn ìpalára wọnyi kii ṣe ohun tó wọpọ, àti pé ọpọlọpọ ènìyàn n lo àwọn ìdènà oyún lai ni iriri àwọn ìpalára lori igbe aye ibalopọ wọn.


 Àwọn ìlànà miiran ti kii ṣe ti homonu bi kondomu tàbí àwọn Iṣeto Ifibọ ile ọmọ ko ni ìpalára si libido rara.
 Ni igbẹhin, o ṣe pataki lati jíròrò eyikeyi àwọn ìdààmú tàbí àwọn ìpalára ti o pọju pẹlu olupese ìlera lati wa ìlànà ti o dara julọ ti o se ibamu pẹlú àwọn ohun ti o fẹ àti sì igbesi aye rẹ.

Àwọn ìlànà ti o ṣiṣẹ dáadáa jùlọ ni awọn Ilana Alapa àti òní kọili.
Àwọn ìlànà miiran ti a tún le lo ni, alabẹrẹ, òògùn ojoojumọ àti daafuramu.
Ti o ba n wa ìlànà ti o ni oye, Onigbigbin sára yìí ni o munadoko julọ.  Nínú àwọn ìlànà  miiran tí o tun munadoko èyí ti o farasin ni àwọn Alabere.

Ti o ba fẹ yago fun idinku/duro sisan oṣu oṣu, Awọn ọna ti o munadoko julọ ni Ifibọ ile ọmọ. 

Ona miiran lati lo ni oogun

O da, ti o  ba fẹ tobi sii, ìlànà ti o munadoko julọ lati gba ni IUD.                     Ọ̀nà mìíràn tí o lè gba ni  Daafuramu àti àwọn ọ̀nà tí kò munadoko lotiti ni kòndọ̀mù, sisa fun ibalopo ní ọjọ́ tí obìnrin ba lè lóyún, àti ọ̀nà ìyọkúrò.

O dára bẹẹ.
Lara awon ilana ti o derun lati ma lo mo lai lo ile iwosan ni alabere,  oloogun ati diaframu.
 Awọn ìlànà miiran ti o ṣiṣẹ to kere jùlọ ti o sì rọrùn láti ma lo mọ ni kondomu, aini ibalopọ ni awọn ọjọ ti o le dọmọ, àti ìlànà yiyọ kuro.

O le padà sí irọmọbí àti pé o le bí ọmọ síi ní kete ti o ba ti dawọ eyikeyi ìlànà duro.

 Àwọn ìlànà ti o lè lo láti tètè padà rọmọ bí ní: 
Awon ilànà ti o ṣiṣẹ jù ni Alapa àti òní kọili
Àwọn ìlànà miiran ti o tún ṣiṣẹ dáadáa ni oògùn lílò àti diafuramu àti pé àwọn ìlànà ti o n ṣiṣẹ to kere jù lọ ni kondomu, àìní ibalopọ ni awọn ọjọ to lè dọmọ ati ìlànà yiyọ kuro.

O dára bẹẹ 
Awon ilànà ti o ṣiṣẹ jù ni Alapa àti òní kọili
Àwọn ìlànà ti o munadoko miiran jẹ Awọn oogun ojoojumọ ati Daafuramu àti pé àwọn ìlànà ti o tún munadoko ti o kere julọ ti o le lo ni awọn kondomu, aini ibalopọ ni awọn ọjọ tí o le dọmọ, ati ìlànà yiyọ kuro.

Ifètò ṣọmọ bibi oní kọili n ṣiṣẹ dáadáa nípa didena oyún nini. (>99%)
Ti o ba fẹ gba àlàyé lórí rẹ  sì, ba ọjọgbọn oníṣègùn soro lori nomba yi 7790.

IUD o ni ìpalára lori ilera rẹ. Ti o ba tun ni aibalẹ ọkàn, o ṣe pataki lati ba olupese eto ilera sọrọ.                                                                               Wọn le pese imọran ti ara ẹni ati pe koju eyikeyi awọn ifiyesi ti o le ni.
Awọn IUD naa rọrun pupọ lati lo.    Tí o ba n ni iriri ìnira kankan, jọwọ pe 7790 lọfẹ láti ba ọjọgbọn oníṣègùn sọrọ.
A loye pe diẹ ninu awọn ọna le ni idiyele pupọ.Jọwọ, pe 7790 lọfẹ, ọjọgbọn oníṣègùn kan yóò ràn ọ lọwọ láti mọ èyí ti ko won ju.

Àwọn wọnyí ni aleebu lilo ilana IUD. 

Ìnira ti o romo sọwọn sugbon won a maa farahàn bí iwọnyi 

1. Ti ohun-elo yìí bá kuro ni ibi to ye ko wa lè yọrí sí oyún níni. 
2. O le lu iho sí ile-omo. 
3. Wọn lè fa awọn Ipalara bíi:
 a. Nnkan oṣù to n se segesege ati pupọjù rẹ . 
b. Ìrora nnkan oṣù 
c. Oju-ara lè máa sún omi tí kò dára jade.                                   Ni deede, wọn kò ní ṣiṣẹ mọ lẹhin ọsẹ diẹ. Ti a ko ba mẹnuba àwọn ààmì àìsàn rẹ loke tabi o tun ni aibalẹ ọkàn, jọwọ ṣabẹwo si olupese ifeto si omo bíbí i rẹ.
Àwọn ìnira bẹẹ sọwọn, ṣugbọn o le ṣeéṣe; Jọwọ, pe 7790 lọfẹ, ọjọgbọn oníṣègùn kan yóò ràn ọ lọwọ láti mọ èyí ti ko won ju.
Ko sí ohun ti o n tini lójú nínú sise ifètò ṣọmọ bibi. Atipe ní ti lilo ìlànà òní kọili, ẹnikẹni ko lè mọ wí pé o n ṣe ifètò ṣọmọ bibi.
Ti o ba n wa ilana idena oyun nini ti ko nilo ilọwọsi ile-iwosan, a lè ri diẹ: Die ni Abẹrẹ, Òògùn, ati Awọn Kondomu
Amfani da IUD wato Na'urar hana daukar ciki ta cikin mahaifa bata da illa a gare ki kuma za ki iya samun ƙarin yara idan kin daina amfani da shi. Yana yuwa kusan nan da nan.
Awọn ifetosomobibi alapa jẹ èyí ti o munadoko gidi láti fi dènà oyún.  Ti o ba fẹ lati jiroro rẹ ni awọn alaye diẹ sii pẹlu alamọdaju oníṣègùn kan, jọwọ pe 7790.
A gbà àwọn ènìyàn ti o ni diẹ ninu àwọn ipo ilera ni imọran lodi si lilo awọn ifetosomobibi alapa. Jọwọ wa imọran lati ọdọ olupese ilera rẹ ṣaaju lilo.
Awọn Ifetosomobibi alapa naa rọrun pupọ lati loTí o ba n ni iriri ìnira kankan, jọwọ pe 7790 lọfẹ láti ba ọjọgbọn oníṣègùn sọrọ.
A loye pe diẹ ninu awọn ọna le ni idiyele pupọ. Jọwọ pe 7790 ati pe alamọdaju iṣoogun kan yoo ran ọ lọwọ lati wa ojutu to dara julọ.

Ìnira ti o romo sọwọn sugbon won a maa farahàn bí iwọnyi a. Orí fifọ
b. Àyà rìnrìn tàbí èébì
c. Ooyi kikọ
d. Ọyàn to lewo ti o sí nira lati tẹ
e. Sisanra sí
f. Àyípadà nnkan oṣù
g. Eje dida loju ara Ni deede, wọn kò ní ṣiṣẹ mọ lẹhin ọsẹ diẹ. Ti a ko ba mẹnuba àwọn ààmì àìsàn rẹ loke tabi o tun ni aibalẹ ọkàn, jọwọ ṣabẹwo si olupese ifeto bíbí i rẹ.
Ifetosomobibi alapa yìí ko nisè pẹlú ìgbé ayé ibalopọ rẹ ayafi ni gbigbẹ oju ara.  A yan fun ọ láti  lo  lubrikant olomi.
Ko si ohun ti o jẹ ohun itiju nígbà ti o ba n se ifeto ṣọmọ bibi. Pàápàá júlọ nipa ti ìlànà adèna ọmọ bíbí ti obìnrin, kò sí ẹnikeni tó lè mọ pé o ń ṣe ifètò ṣọmọ bibi.
Ti o ba n wa ilana idena oyun nini ti ko nilo ilọwọsi ile-iwosan, a lè ri diẹ: Die ni Abẹrẹ, Òògùn, ati Awọn Kondomu
Ìlànà onigbigbin sára yìí ko léwu àti pé o le bí ọmọ síi nígbà ti o ba dá lilo rẹ dúró.                                           Ní kete ti o b dá lílo Ifibọ ile ọmọ dúró o le loyun lẹsẹkẹsẹ.

sterilisasion ti obìnrin yìí ṣe é yipada nígbà gbogbo.

 Lati mọ sii, jọwọ ṣabẹwo si olupese ilera rẹ fún àlàyé kíkún. ..
O ko nilo lati lọ sì ile-iwosan mọ lẹhin  ti o ba ti parí ṣíṣe ilana yii. Jọwọ lọ sì ọdọ oníṣègùn ìlera rẹ fún àlàyé kíkún síi.
sterilisasion yìí, ẹnikẹni ko lè mọ pé o n lo o.
sterilisasion yìí ko nise pẹlú isesi ibalopọ rẹ.
Awọn aisedede rẹ ṣọwọn ṣugbọn ti o ba ni aibale okan, jọwọ ṣabẹwo si olupese ifètò ṣọmọ bibi rẹ.
Ìlànà yii munadoko gidi nípa didena oyún nini. Ti o ba fẹ lati jiroro rẹ ni àwọn àlàyé lẹkunrẹrẹ sii pẹlu ọjọgbọn oníṣègùn kan, jọwọ pe 7790.
A gbà awọn ènìyàn ti o ni awọn ipo ilera ni imọran lodi si lilo Awọn abẹrẹ Jọwọ wa imọran lati ọdọ olupese ilera rẹ.
Awọn abẹrẹ naa rọrun pupọ lati lo. Ti o ba ni iriri eyikeyi tí o ni ọ lara jọwọ pe 7790 fun ọfẹ lati ba nọọsi sọrọ.
A loye pe diẹ ninu awọn ọna le ni idiyele pupọ. Jọwọ pe 7790 ati pe alamọdaju iṣoogun kan yoo ran ọ lọwọ lati wa ojutu to dara julọ.

Ìnira ti o romo sọwọn sugbon won a maa farahàn bí iwọnyi a. Àyípadà iwọn
b. Orí-fífo
c. Ooyi
d. Ọyàn ti o lewo ti o si n dun ni die
e. Àyípadà isesi
f. Àyípadà nnkan oṣù
g. Adinku ipohungbe fun ibalopo Ni deede, wọn kò ní ṣiṣẹ mọ lẹhin ọsẹ diẹ. Ti a ko ba mẹnuba àwọn ààmì àìsàn rẹ loke tabi o tun ni aibalẹ ọkàn, jọwọ ṣabẹwo si olupese ifeto bíbí i rẹ.
Ilana Abẹrẹ ko niise pẹlú igbe aye ibalopọ rẹ àyàfi fun gbigbẹ. A ṣe iṣeduro lilo ipara olomi.
Ko si ohun itiju nípa ṣiṣe ifeto ṣọmọ bibi. Pàápàá júlọ, pẹlu lilo abẹrẹ, ko si ẹnikan ti yoo mọ pe o n ṣe ifeto ṣọmọ bibi.

O ko ni lati ṣabẹwo si ile-iwosan lati da abẹrẹ yìí dúró, kò ní ṣiṣẹ mọ lẹhin oṣu méjì sì mẹta. Ti o ba n wa ilana idena oyun ti ko nilo ilọsi ile-iwosan, a sì le ri diẹ nínú wọn: Abẹrẹ , Òògùn, ati Kondomu

Ko séwu nínú lilo ìlànà yìí ati pe o le bí ọmọ sii ni ọjọ iwájú. Àwọn obinrin ti o da lilo abẹrẹ yìí duro máa saaba ni ìdádúró o kere ju oṣu mẹfa ṣaaju oyun. O le jù bẹẹ lọ o da lori bi ilera rẹ bá se rí.
Ọna yii jẹ doko gidi ni idilọwọ oyun.  Ti o ba fẹ lati jiroro rẹ ni awọn alaye diẹ sii pẹlu alamọdaju iṣoogun kan, jọwọ pe 7790.

Awọn oogun yii ko ni ipa lori ilera rẹ. Ti o ba tun ni aibalẹ ọkàn, o ṣe pataki lati ba olupese ètò ilera sọrọ.                                                                 Wọn le pèsè imọran ti ara ẹni ki wọn sì kojú eyikeyi àwọn ifiyesi ti o le ni.
Awọn oogun yìí rọrun pupọ lati lo. Ti o ba ni iriri eyikeyi inira, jọwọ pe 7790 fun ọfẹ lati ba nọọsi sọrọ.
O ye wa wí pé àwọn ìlànà miiran le gbowo lórí púpọ. Jọwọ, pe 7790 lọfẹ, ọjọgbọn oníṣègùn kan yóò ràn ọ lọwọ láti mọ èyí ti ko won ju.

Lilọ òògùn yìi gbọdọ jẹ ojoojumọ eyi ti o le nira lati tẹle. 

Won lè fa ìwọnba ìpalára fún eyi tí yóò lọ leyin ọsẹ diẹ, lára wọn ni: 
a. Orí-fífo diẹ 
b. Aya rìnrìn tàbí èébì 
c. Ṣiṣe iranran tàbí sísun ẹjẹ  
d. Oyan ti o lewo die, ti o nira atifọwọ kan. 
e. Àyípadà nipa ìṣesí    
Ni deede, wọn kò ní ṣiṣẹ mọ lẹhin ọsẹ diẹ. Ti a ko ba mẹnuba àwọn ààmì aisan rẹ loke tabi o tun ni aibalẹ ọkàn, jọwọ ṣabẹwo si olupese ifeto ṣọmọ bibi rẹ.
Ìlànà yii ko nisè pẹlú ìgbé  ayé ibalopọ rẹ ayafi fun gbigbẹ tabi ki o ma le ṣee dáadáa.  Jọwọ lo ipara ti olomi ati siṣere siwaju ibalopọ.
Ko sí ohun ti o n tini lójú nínú sise ifètò ṣọmọ bibi. Atipe ní ti lilo oogùn, ẹnikẹni ko lè mọ wí pé o n ṣe ifètò ṣọmọ bibi.
O ko ni lati ṣabẹwo si ile-iwosan lati dawọ lilo àwọn òògùn naa duro.  Ti o ba n wa ìlànà ìdènà oyún ti ko nilo ilọwọsi ile-iwosan, diẹ wa látí mọ: Abẹrẹ, Òògùn, ati Àwọn Kondomu
Adèna ọmọ bíbí ti ko nilo isọdọtun.   Jọwọ pe 7790 ati pe ọjọgbọn oníṣègùn kan yoo fun ọ ni alaye diẹ sii.
sterilisasion  naa rọrun pupọ lati lo.    Tí o ba n ni iriri ìnira kankan, jọwọ pe 7790 lọfẹ láti ba ọjọgbọn oníṣègùn sọrọ.

sterilisasion yìí ko ni ìpalára lori ilera rẹ. Ti o ba tun ni aibalẹ ọkàn, o ṣe pataki lati ba olupese eto ilera sọrọ.                                                               Wọn le pese imọran ti ara ẹni ati pe koju eyikeyi awọn ifiyesi ti o le ni.
Ọna yii jẹ doko gidi ni idilọwọ oyun.  Ti o ba fẹ lati jiroro rẹ ni awọn alaye diẹ sii pẹlu alamọdaju iṣoogun kan, jọwọ pe 7790.

sterilisasion ti obìnrin yìí ṣe é yipada nígbà gbogbo.

 Lati mọ sii, jọwọ ṣabẹwo si olupese ilera rẹ fún àlàyé kíkún.
O ko nilo lati lọ sì ile-iwosan mọ lẹhin  ti o ba ti parí ṣíṣe ilana yii. Jọwọ lọ sì ọdọ oníṣègùn ìlera rẹ fún àlàyé kíkún síi.
Ko si ohun itiju nípa ṣiṣe ifeto ṣọmọ bibi. Pàápàá júlọ, pẹlu sterilisasion ti obìnrin , ko si ẹnikan ti yoo mọ pe o n ṣe ifeto ṣọmọ bibi.
sterilisasion ti obìnrin yìí ko nise pẹlú isesi ibalopọ rẹ.

Ìnira ti o romo sọwọn sugbon won a maa farahàn bí iwọnyi  
a. Ìrora isalẹ ikun tàbí pajápajá. 
b. Rire. 
c. Ooyi 
d. Ni ategun tabi wiwu 
e. Ejika riro 
 Ti a ko ba mẹnuba àwọn ààmì aisan rẹ loke tabi o tun ni aibalẹ ọkàn, jọwọ ṣabẹwo si olupese ifeto ṣọmọ bibi rẹ.
Ìlànà  yìí ko léwu àti pé o le bí ọmọ síi nígbà ti o ba dá lilo rẹ dúró.                             Ní kete ti o b dá lílo Ifibọ ile ọmọ dúró o le loyun lẹsẹkẹsẹ.
Wannan hanyar tana da matukar tasiri wajen hana ciki. Idan kina son tattauna shi da kuma ƙarin cikakkun bayanai tare da ƙwararren likita mu, da fatan za a kira 7790.

sterilisasion yìí ko ni ìpalára lori ilera rẹ. Ti o ba tun ni aibalẹ ọkàn, o ṣe pataki lati ba olupese eto ilera sọrọ.                                                                                                      Wọn le pese imọran ti ara ẹni ati pe koju eyikeyi awọn ifiyesi ti o le ni.
Tsarin tsayawa na mace yana da sauƙin amfani. Idan kana jin wata irin rashin jin dadi, don Allah kira 7790 kyauta don yin magana da jinya.

Improve Sexual Health/Intimacy
Gels and Lubricants

Lubricants, also called gels or lubes, are special fluids used during sex. They help reduce friction, discomfort, and dryness, making sex more pleasurable and preventing condoms from breaking. Lubricants come in water-based, silicone-based, or oil-based types. Water-based lubes are safe with all condoms, they don't change the vagina's pH, don't stain clothes, and wash off easily with water. Silicone and oil-based lubes should only be used with specific condom materials.

Click to listen to a short introduction of Lubricant in Pidgin, if you want.
Hard Erection

Penegra is a product that used to treat erectile dysfunction. Erectile Dysfunction refers to the consistent/inability of a man to obtain an erection sufficient for satisfactory sex.

Penegra helps to induce a hard erection which can last for an extended duration thereby enhancing confidence, well-being, and satisfaction. Penegra only induces a hard erection when the penis is stimulated.
You can click on the audio below to listen to a short introduction of Penegra in Pidgin, if you want to.
Kuna iya dannawa don kallon bidiyo kan yadda ake amfani da wannan man shafawa a Pidgin.

Sex can be enjoyed more with lubricants and gels.
Hard erection can also be induced for more pleasured sex.

Effect on future pregnancies

IUDs are very effective in preventing pregnancy (>99%).

If you would like to discuss it  in more details with a medical professional, please call 7790.

The IUD does not have any negative effects on your health. 

If you're still worried about the IUD and its effects on your health, it's important to talk to a healthcare provider.

They can provide personalized advice and address any concerns you may have.

We understand some methods could get too costly.

Please call 7790 and a medical professional will help you to find a more affordable solution.

The IUD is very convenient to use.

If you are experiencing any form of discomfort, kindly call 7790 for free to speak to a nurse.

Complications are rare but may occur and they include:
1. Expulsion of IUD, which may lead to pregnancy.
2. Uterine perforation.

They might cause some side effects such as:
a. Irregular and heavy period or bleeding.
b. Menstrual cramps.
c. Abnormal vaginal discharge.

Normally, they wear out after a few weeks. If your symptoms are not mentioned above or you are still worried, please visit your family planning provider.

Complications like that are rare, but possible.

Please call 7790 so medical professional will help to find a better solution.
There is nothing to be ashamed when doing family planning. Moreover, with the IUD, no one will know you are using it.
The IUD method is safe and you can have more children when you stop using it. It is possible almost immediately.
If you're seeking a contraceptive method that doesn't require clinic involvement, there are a few to consider: Some Injection, Pills, and Condoms.

Implants are very effective in preventing pregnancy. If you would like to discuss it in more details with a medical professional, please call 7790.
People with some health conditions are advised against the use of the Implants.  Please seek counsel from your health provider before use.

We understand some methods could get too costly.

Please call 7790 for free and a medical professional will help you to find a more affordable solution.

The Implant is very convenient to use.

If you are experiencing any form of discomfort, kindly call 7790 for free to speak to a medical professional.

Complications are rare but may occur and they include;
a. Headache.
b. Nausea or vomiting.
c. Dizziness.
d. Breast tenderness.
e. Weight gain.
f. Menstrual changes.
g. Spotting and irregular vaginal bleeding. 

Normally, they wear out after a few weeks. If your symptoms are not mentioned above or you are still worried, please visit your family planning provider.
The Implant is not affecting your sexual life except for dryness. We recommend using a water-based lubricant.
There is nothing to be ashamed when doing family planning. Moreover, with the Implant, no one will know you are doing family planning.

The Implant method is safe and you can have more children when you stop using it. 
Once you stop using the IUD you can get pregnant almost immediately.
If you're seeking a contraceptive method that doesn't require clinic involvement, there are a few to consider: Some Injection, Pill, and Condoms.

The most effective methods for quick return to fertility are Implants and IUD.

Other effective methods are Daily Pills and Diaphragm and the least effective methods you can use are the condoms, abstinence from sex on fertile days, and the withdrawal method.

The effects of contraceptive methods on sex life can vary depending on individual experiences and preferences.

Some methods, like hormonal contraceptives (such as birth control pills, patches, or IUDs), may have side effects like changes in libido, mood swings, or dryness.

However, these effects are not universal, and many individuals use contraceptives without experiencing negative impacts on their sex lives.


Other non-hormonal methods like condoms or copper IUDs typically don't affect libido.
Ultimately, it's essential to discuss any concerns or potential side effects with a healthcare provider to find the best option that suits your needs and lifestyle.

The pill stops your body from ovulating, but as soon as you stop taking the pill, Your ovulation will start again . So, it's possible to get pregnant as soon as you stop the pill.

In most cases, it's possible to become pregnant after 3 months, but it usually takes several additional months for the complete effect of the hormone to wear off and to begin ovulating and having regular periods again.

Improve Sexual Health/Intimacy
Gels and Lubricants

Lubricants, also called gels or lubes, are special fluids used during sex. They help reduce friction, discomfort, and dryness, making sex more pleasurable and preventing condoms from breaking. Lubricants come in water-based, silicone-based, or oil-based types. Water-based lubes are safe with all condoms, they don't change the vagina's pH, don't stain clothes, and wash off easily with water. Silicone and oil-based lubes should only be used with specific condom materials.

Click to listen to a short introduction of Lubricant in Pidgin, if you want.
Hard Erection

Penegra is a product that used to treat erectile dysfunction. Erectile Dysfunction refers to the consistent/inability of a man to obtain an erection sufficient for satisfactory sex.

Penegra helps to induce a hard erection which can last for an extended duration thereby enhancing confidence, well-being, and satisfaction. Penegra only induces a hard erection when the penis is stimulated.
You can click on the audio below to listen to a short introduction of Penegra in Pidgin, if you want to.
You can click to watch a video on how to use this lubricant in Pidgin.

Sex can be enjoyed more with lubricants and gels.
Hard erection can also be induced for more pleasured sex.

I had unprotected sex recently. What do I do to avoid pregnancy?
I want to prevent pregnancy in the future.

To avoid pregnancy after unprotected sex, you can take emergency contraceptive pills.

Emergency contraceptive pills are taken immediately after unprotected sex to prevent pregnancy.

Emergency pills are very effective when taken within 24 to 72 hours after unprotected sex. You are advised to not take it more than 3 times in a month. If you are ovulating, you should use an alternative contraceptive plan (condoms).

Please note that they are not effective if you are already pregnant.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available emergency contraceptive pills.

Postpill can be taken within 5 days after sex, while Postinor2 is effective within 3 days.

Allright. I am happy to provide you with more information about family planning methods that are effective and safe for you.

Short Term
(up to 1 year)

Long Term
(1 year to permanent)

The short-term family planning methods are:

1. Daily contraceptive pills
2. The barrier contraceptives which are the diaphragms and Condoms
3. Injectables.

Click on any of them to get the full details about them.
For how long do you want to prevent pregnancy?

Postpill is a one-dose emergency contraceptive pill by DKT. It contains 1.5 mg Levongestrel. POSTPILL should be taken orally as soon as possible within 24 hours but can still be taken within 5 days (120 hours) of unprotected sex.

You can buy Postpill at any pharmacy or health store around you.

Postinor is an Emergency Contraceptive Pill (ECP) that safely prevents unwanted pregnancy within 72 hours after unprotected sexual intercourse.

It doesn’t work if you are already pregnant and will not harm an already established pregnancy. The sooner you take POSTINOR, the more effective it is.

You can buy Postinor at any pharmacy or health store around you.
Daily contraceptive pills
Female condom
Male Condom

Daily pills are combined oral contraceptive (COC) pills for pregnancy prevention, dermatological and gynecological conditions, and management of menstrual irregularities (heavy bleeding, painful menstruation, premenstrual syndrome).
They work by thickening the mucus around the cervix, which makes it difficult for sperm to enter the uterus and reach any eggs that may have been released.
Daily pills are either a 21-day pack (Dianofem and Desofem) or a 28-day pack (Levofem). One pill is taken each day at about the same time for 21 days. Depending on your pack, you will either have a 7-day break (as in the 21-day pack) or you will take the pill that contains Iron for 7 days (the 28-day pack).
Click to listen to a short introduction of daily pills in Pidgin, if you want to.
Audio embedding (Daily pills)

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of daily pills includes.

Advantages

1. They are very effective if used correctly.
2. Very safe for the majority of women.
3. Return to fertility is very fast.
4. They regularize the menstrual cycle, reduce heavy menstrual flow, and reduce menstrual and ovulation pain.
5. They are simple and easy to use.

and Disadvantages
1. They must be taken daily which might be difficult to comply with.
2. They might cause mild and temporary side effect which usually goes away after some weeks such as:
a. Mild headache.
b. Nausea or vomiting.
c. Spotting or bleeding at intervals.
d. Breast tenderness and soreness to touch.
e. Mood changes.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use daily pills.

Who can use
1.You can use daily pills if you want a short-term contraceptive method.
2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from six months after birth)
3. If you have irregular menstrual cycle.
4. If you don't have migrainous headaches.
5. If you are taking antibiotics, antifungal or antiparasitic medications.
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?

Who cannot use 1. If you are a breastfeeding mother from 6 weeks to 6 months postpartum. 2. If you are a smoker and over 35 years old. 3. If you have any of the following medical conditions, it is not advisable to take daily piils: a. Blood Pressure b. Venous thromboembolism c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease f. Breast Cancer g. Diabetes h. Sickle-cell Anaemia
I don't know
Ok, it is not advisable for you to take daily pills. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraceptive.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available daily contraceptive pills.
Click on any of them to get their full details.

Levofem is a safe, low-dose, combined oral contraceptive used to prevent pregnancy. Each pack contains 21 active yellow tablets and 7 placebo(inactive) tablets which should be taken around the same time daily.
You can buy Levofem at any pharmacy or health store around you.

How to Use 1. Take your first pill from the packet marked with the correct day of the week, or the first pill of the first colour (phasic pills) 2. Continue to take a pill at the same time each day until the pack is finished. Continue taking pills for seven days (during these seven days you will get a bleed). 3. Start your next pack of pills on the eighth day, whether you are still bleeding or not. This should be the same day of the week as when you took your first pill

Dianofem is a safe and effective pill that contains a combination of an antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) and estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) used for the treatment of dermatological and gynecological conditions in women. It also prevents pregnancy. It contains 21 tablets with no placebo (inactive pills).
How to Use<br style="border-color: var(--border-color);">Take one tablet daily for 21 days, followed by a 7-day break where no tablets are taken. Start the next pack after the 7-day break.

How to Use
One pill is taken around the same time daily for 21 days followed by a 7-day break, then continue with the next pack.

Injectable contraceptives are a form of hormonal birth control for women. They consist of 2-3 monthly injections containing an estrogen and a progestin to prevent pregnancy.

The injection works by preventing the ovaries from releasing an egg each month. It also thickens the fluid around the cervix.

They can be used for pregnancy prevention for 1 to 3 months.

Ok, let me tell you some of the advantages and disadvantages of injectable contraceptives.

Advantages
1. They are highly effective and safe.
2. They do not interfer with sexual intercourse.
3. They can be self administered or provided by a trained non-medical personnel.
4. They protect against ectopic pregnancy.
5.They reduce symptoms of endometriosis.
6. They are convenient, easy to use and administered once in a month.

Now to the disadvantages of injectable contraceptives.

Disadvantages
1. They require regular visit to the to the clinic (monthly)
2. Return to fertility is delayed.
3.Their commom sides effects include:
a. Weight changes.
b. Headache.
c. Dizziness.
d. Breast tenderness.
e. Mood changes.
f. Menstrual change.
g. Decreased libido.
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?

On who can use and who cannot use injectables.
Who can use 1. Women who cannot use combined oral contraceptives. 2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from six months after birth) 3. If you just had an abortion or miscarriage and still want to prevent pregnancy. 4. If you dont't have migrainous headaches. 5. If you have endometrial or ovarian cancer, you can still use this method.

Who cannot use 1. If you are a breastfeeding mother from 6 weeks to 6 months postpartum. 2. If you are a smoker and over 35 years old. 3. If you have any of the following medical conditions, it is not advisable to take daily piils: a. Blood Pressure. b. Venous thromboembolism. c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease. f. Breast Cancer. g. Diabetes. h. Vascular Disease. i. Vaginal bleeding
I don't know

Ok, sorry about your medical condition but it is not advisable for you to adopt this method of contraception.

Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraceptive.

Progesta is an injectable contraceptive, a highly safe and effective contraceptive, injected intramuscularly and sometimes into the anus for 3 months continuously. 

Its mechanism of action are
• thicken cervical mucus.
• inhibits ovulation.
• thins uterus walls to prevent ovulation.
You can visit a family planning clinic/provider if you want to adopt this method.
Audio embedding (Progesta)

Advantages of progesta include 
• Safe, highly effective, discontinued at will.
• Long-acting, 
• Provided outside the clinic, 
• Reversible, easy to use, private, and non-contraceptive benefit. 

Users include heavy smokers, thyroid disorders, diabetes, those 18 years old or younger, breastfeeding mothers, and pelvic inflammatory diseases.

How to use 
• Injected in the upper arm or buttocks, start at any time during the menstrual cycle. 
• 5 days after menstrual period, abstain from sex for the next 7 days. 
• It can be administered after abortion. 
• Start 6 weeks after delivery for a breastfeeding woman.

Sayana Press is indicated for long-term female contraception. Each subcutaneous injection prevents ovulation and provides contraception for at least 13 weeks

A diaphragm or cap is a type of barrier contraceptive device inserted into the vagina before sex to cover the cervix so that sperm can't get into the womb (uterus). You need to use spermicide with it (spermicides kill sperm). The diaphragm must be left in place for at least 6 hours after sex. The diaphragm is a vaginal barrier contraceptive that is woman-controlled, nonhormonal, and appropriate for women who cannot or do not want to use hormonal contraceptive methods, intrauterine devices, or condoms.
Click to listen to a short introduction of diaphragm in Pidgin, if you want.
Audio embedding (Diaphragm)

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of Diaphragms.

Advantages
1. Diaphragms do not have hormones, so no side effects.
2. Good option for women who prefer non-hormonal contraceptive methods.
3. They may be fitted at any time (post-partum mothers must wait for 6 weeks after delivery or mid-trimester abortion) 
4. They can be inserted up to 6 hours before sex to avoid interruption. 
5. Only used when needed and gives the woman absolute control.
6. One size fits most women.
7. Portable and convenient - it comes with a specially designed case that is discreet and fits in a bag.
8. Easy to use - insertion and removal gets better with practice.
9. Can be used for up to 2 years with proper care.

and 

Disadvantages
1. They are not readily available in Nigeria.
2. They may be expensive to some users.
3. The user must remember to insert the diaphragm before intercourse and keep it in place for at least 6 hours after sex (but not more than 24 hours) 
4. They require special care and storage.
5. They can cause urinary tract infections.
6. A different size of diaphragm may be required after childbirth or if a woman gains weight.
7. They can be damaged by excessive use or poor storage

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use diaphragms.

Who can use
1. If you want a safe and effective non-hormonal form of contraceptive.
2. If you cannot use hormonal methods of contraception for medical reasons.
3. If you are breastfeeding.
4. If you have sexual intercourse occasionally.

Who cannot use
1. If you have an allergy or are sensitive to latex rubber or spermicide.
2. If you have severe uterine prolapse (when the uterus descends toward or into the vagina)
3. If have recurrent urinary tract infections.
4. If you lack facilities (soap and water) to taking care of the diaphragm.

Female condoms are a barrier method of contraception worn inside the vagina. They are made of thin soft plastic and have two ﬂexible rings – a removable ring at the closed end to help insertion and a fixed ring at the open end, which sits on the vulva to hold the condom in place They prevent pregnancy by stopping sperm from meeting an egg.
and one of its disadvantages is that it might make unpleasant noise during intercourse.

On who can use and who cannot use female condoms.

Who can use
1. If you want a safe and effective non-hormonal form of contraceptive.
2. If you cannot use hormonal methods of contraception for medical reasons.
3. If you have sexual intercourse occasionally.
4. If you have multiple sexual partners

Then if you have genital /uterine prolapse (when the uterus descends toward or into the vagina), you cannot use the female condom.

Contraceptive implants are small, flexible rods inserted under the skin, typically in the arm. They release hormones (usually progestin) to prevent pregnancy.

They are long-term birth control methods also called long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC. They provide contraception, lasting up to 3 - 5 years but can be removed at any time.

They work by preventing the release of egg and thickening the cervical mucus making it difficult for sperm to reach the egg.
Audio embedding (Implants)
Click to listen to a short explanation of implants in Pidgin, if you want to.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of contraceptive implants.

Advantages
1. They can be used at any time in the menstrual cycle, are very effective, and are removed whenever you want to get pregnant.
2. It gives total privacy, no one will know you have it and does not interfere with sex.
3. No frequent clinical follow-up is needed after initial insertion.
4. It is estrogen-free so many people can use it
5. They are long-acting and may help prevent ectopic pregnancy.
6. Does not disturb breast milk production.
7. There is no delay in return to fertility when they are removed.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use implants.

Who can use
1. You can use an implant if you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 1 to 3 years.
2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from 6 weeks after birth)
3. If you cannot tolerate estrogen.
4. If you don't have migrainous headaches.
5. If you have endometrial or ovarian cancer, you can still use this method.

Disadvantages
1. Insertion and removal involve minor surgery and must be performed by a trained professional.
2. You cannot discontinue the method by yourself.
3. They might have some side effects such as:
a. Headache.
b. Nausea or vomiting.
c. Dizziness.
d. Breast tenderness.
e. Weight gain.
f. Menstrual changes.
g. Spotting and irregular vaginal bleeding.

Who cannot use You cannot use implants if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Uncontrolled hypertension. b. Venous thromboembolism. c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease. f. Breast Cancer. g. Kidney infection. h. Vaginal bleeding.
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?

LEVOPLANT which is a subdermal contraceptive implant, Levoplant has two small flexible rods about matchstick size. It is WHO-prequalified and highly effective for 3 years, it is suitable for most women except pregnant women.

Advantages
• Immediate return to fertility.
• Fewer side effects.
• Thinner trocar for the insertion process. 
• High quality and most affordable 3-year implant in Nigeria.

Common side effects:
• Menstrual changes.
• Headaches.
• Dizziness. 
• Weight changes (loss/Gain)- which is a buildup of water not fat.
• Breast tenderness
ADOPTION (CLINIC)

Jadelle is a contraceptive implant that consists of two small flexible rods (as short as a match stick but thinner) that is inserted under the skin of a woman’s upper arm. It contains 75mg of the hormone Levonorgestrel in each rod. Jadelle implants are over 99% effective and can prevent pregnancy for a period of 5 years.

This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases very low dose of hormone which leaves the body quickly when removed, so the woman can get pregnant without delay.
You can visit a family planning clinic/provider if you want to adopt this method.

Implanon NXT is a contraceptive implant that consists of one small flexible rod that is inserted under the skin of a woman’s upper arm. It contains 65mg of the hormone Etonorgestrel in each rod. Implanon NXT is over 99% effective and can prevent pregnancy for 3 years. Also, it can be stopped anytime the woman wants by asking a health provider to remove it. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases a very low dose of hormone, which leaves the body quickly when removed, so you woman can get pregnant without delay.

Some of its common side effects are
• Headaches.
• Dizziness.
• Breast tenderness.
• Nausea
• Stomach cramping/bloating.
• Weight gain.
• Vaginal irritation/discharge may occur.
If you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 3 - 4 years, it is advisable to adopt long-acting reversible contraception or LARC methods.

Long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC are: 1. The Injectables. 2. The Implants. 3. The IUS. 4. The IUD
While the short-acting methods are: 1. The daily contraceptive Pills. 2. The emergency contraceptive pills. 3. The barrier contraceptives
Choose any them from the options to get the full details about them.
You can still adopt the short-acting family planning methods or the barrier contraceptives if you don't want any device insertion into your body.

Intrauterine system (IUS) are hormonal intrauterine device (IUD). They contain Levenorgestrel for the treatment of some gynecological conditions (endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial hyperplasia, etc.) and pregnancy prevention. It has contraceptive coverage for up to 5 years.

How they work 

For pregnancy prevention, it works by thickening the mucus in the cervix to stop sperm from fertilizing an egg. It also thins out the lining of the uterus and suppresses ovulation and for gynaecological conditions, it reduces the endometrial lining of the womb making the period lighter and less painful.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUS.

Advantages
For pregnancy prevention:
1. No daily use is required.
2. Insertion and removal can be done at any time within the menstrual cycle.
3. Do not require regular clinic visits.
4. It has a quick return to fertility after removal.
5. Safe for breastfeeding mothers from six weeks after delivery.
6. Local release of the home ensures milder side effects.
7. It maintains normal libido.
8. Reduces the risk of ovarian cancer and endometrial cancer.
9. Lower overall risk of ectopic pregnancy than women not on contraception.

For gynecological use:
1. Starts working within 24 hours after insertion.
2. Highly effective for the treatment of abnormally heavy menstrual bleeding.
3. Lowers the risk of anemia due to menstrual blood loss.
4. Effective alternative to surgery especially for women who cannot afford to pay for surgery.
Click to listen to a short explanation of IUS in Pidgin, if you want to.
Audio embedding (Hormonal IUS)
This means that you can use IUS for both gynecological matters and to prevent pregnancy.

Now to the disadvantages of IUS.
Disadvantages 1. Your periods may become irregular or stop completely, which may not be suitable for some people. 2. Self-limiting follicular cysts may develop in the first few cycles. 3. If you get an infection when you have an IUS fitted, it could lead to a pelvic infection if it's not treated. 4. In rare cases, an IUS can make a hole in the womb when it's put in. 5. They might have some side effects such as: a. Headache. b. Nausea or vomiting. c. Breast tenderness. d. Lower abdominal cramps. e. Irregular uterine/vaginal bleeding.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use IUS.

Who can use
1. You can use IUS if you cannot use combined contraceptives.
2. If can use IUS even if you are HIV positive.

Who cannot use You cannot use IUS if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Uncontrolled hypertension. b. Stroke. c. Heart Disease. d. Liver Disease. e. Breast Cancer. f. Cervical cancer. g. Kidney infection. h. Unexplained vaginal bleeding
Ok, sorry about your medical condition but it is not advisable for you to use IUS. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraception.

Eloira, which is an IUS different from an IUD due to the absence of copper. A hormone (Levonorgestrel) replaces the copper. It is used to treat gynecological conditions and pregnancy prevention.
ADOPTION (CLINIC)

An IUD (Intrauterine Device) is a small T or Y-shaped contraceptive device inserted into the uterus to prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years. They are usually called Copper T or Copper Y.

They are long-lasting, easily reversible, safe, and more than 99% effective in preventing unintended pregnancy.

They work by providing an environment that is toxic and hostile for the sperm thereby preventing them from fertilizing an egg.
Click to listen to a short explanation of IUD in Pidgin, if you want to.
Audio embedding (IUD)

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUD.

Advantages
1. IUDs are highly effective and safe for a majority of women.
2. They are 100% hormone-free, so no hormonal side effects.
3. Can be removed at any time with immediate return to fertility.
4. Can be used as an emergency contraceptive if inserted within 5 days of having unprotected sex.
5. They are private and independent of intercourse.
6. They are long-lasting and can prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years with no drug interaction.

Now to the disadvantages of IUD.

Disadvantages
Complications are rare but may occur and they include;
1. Expulsion of IUD, which may lead to pregnancy.
2. Uterine perforation.
3. They might cause some side effects such as:
a. Irregular and heavy period or bleeding.
b. Menstrual cramps.
c. Abnormal vaginal discharge.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use IUD.

Who can use
1. You can use an IUD if you are very sexually active.
2. You can use an IUD even if you are a breastfeeding mother, a smoker, or have diabetes and hypertension.
3. You can use an IUD if you have currently or history of certain health conditions like stroke, heart disease, liver disease, breast cancer, headaches, lupus, vein thrombosis, etc, and cannot use hormonal contraceptives.
4. You can use an IUD even if you are taking drugs like anti-tuberculosis drugs, anti-convulsant drugs, or anti-retroviral agents, etc.

Who cannot use You cannot use an IUD if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Cervical cancer. b. Endometrial disease. c. Unexplained vaginal bleeding. d. Uterine fibroid with cavity distortion. e. Pelvic tuberculosis. f. Untreated vaginal infection. g. STIs like gonorrhoea and chlamydia.
So do you currently have or previously had any of the medical conditions listed?

Lydia IUD devices are non-hormonal, long-lasting contraception (5-10 yrs.) DKT has 5 variants which can be T (the most common) or Y-shaped - made of plastic coat with copper. This device is inserted into the uterus and it is the most effective contraceptive according to WHO with about 99.9% efficacy. It can also serve as an emergency contraceptive if used within 5days of unprotected sexual intercourse.
Its mechanism of action is to inhibit sperm penetration due to the toxicity of copper to sperm

Permanent family planning methods means the person will no longer be able to reproduce again. 

Male: Vasectomy
Female: Tubal ligation

Click on any of them to get a short explanation on them.
Tubal Litigation

Vasectomy is a form of male birth control that cuts the supply of sperm to your semen. It's done by cutting and sealing the tubes that carry sperm.
Vasectomy has a low risk of problems and can usually be performed in an outpatient setting under local anesthesia.
You will need to consult a health care provider.

Tubal Litigation is surgery women can get to "tie" their fallopian tubes. It's a type of female sterilization. The goal is to prevent eggs from travelling from the ovaries to the uterus so you can't get pregnant.

Some of its common side effects are:
a. Abdominal pain or cramping.
b. Fatigue.
c. Dizziness.
d. Gassiness or bloating.
e. Shoulder pain.

You will need to consult a health care provider.

I see! You are at the right place, I can assist you with this topic. 

What best describes your situation?
If more than 120 hours (5 days) have passed since unprotected sex, it won't be effective. In such a situation, kindly consult a healthcare provider as soon as possible to explore other options.

If more than 72 hours (3 days) have passed since unprotected sex, it won't be effective. In such a situation, kindly consult a healthcare provider as soon as possible to explore other options.  It's essential not to delay seeking medical advice in such cases to address any potential risks.

c. Abnormal vaginal discharge.

The most effective methods for quick return to fertility are Implants and IUD.

Other effective methods are Daily Pills and Diaphragm and the least effective methods you can use are the condoms, abstinence from sex on fertile days, and the withdrawal method.

The effects of contraceptive methods on sex life can vary depending on individual experiences and preferences.

Some methods, like hormonal contraceptives (such as birth control pills, patches, or IUDs), may have side effects like changes in libido, mood swings, or dryness.

However, these effects are not universal, and many individuals use contraceptives without experiencing negative impacts on their sex lives.


Other non-hormonal methods like condoms or copper IUDs typically don't affect libido.
Ultimately, it's essential to discuss any concerns or potential side effects with a healthcare provider to find the best option that suits your needs and lifestyle.

Ok, if you do not want to gain weight, the most effective method to adopt is the IUD.

Other method to adopt is the Diaphragm and the least effective methods you can use are the condoms, abstinence from sex on fertile days, and the withdrawal method.

The methods that are completely painless are the condoms and diaphrams but they are not as effective as the injectibles, implants and the IUDs. With the injectibles and implants, most people do not experience side effects but some people experience mild headaches. With the IUDs most people do not experience any discomfort after insertion but some people report mild abdominal pain.
